jobTitle: Cashiers and Team Leaders wanted Job in Auckland - SEEK
email: Please send all CV’s through to Joanna@savorgroup.cp.nz
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50675906.txt	§Cashiers and Team Leaders wanted§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Cashiers and Team Leaders wanted§§Advertiser: §Savor Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Supervisors/Team Leaders§§§§§§FOH staff required for fast-paced dining precinct§ §Savor Group - the minds behind renowned and award winning Auckland venues Ostro, Ebisu and Azabu – have an exciting new opening this November and you could be a part of it!§ §Set in the heart of Auckland’s waterfront, with amazing super yacht’s and beautiful sea views, Auckland’s fish market is a modern open style venue with a state of the art fit-out. Open seven days a week, this destination is becoming one of the leading tourist destinations in Auckland.§ §Renowned for creating original food and entertainments experiences at unique locations this is the next step for Savor Group.§ §We are looking for enthusiastic, experienced, outgoing, and confident FOH staff to be part of our venues at The Auckland Fishmarkets. § §Our ideal candidates will have:§ § §An obvious passion for customer service within the hospitality industry§ §Willing to learn and grow within the company§ §Be available to work weekdays and weekends§ §We are welcoming all applicants!§ §We can offer you:§ § §A wonderful work environment, part of a knowledgeable and friendly team.§ §Driven and supportive leadership.§ §A competitive salary.§ §Employee benefits and discounts across Savor Group.§ §A Career –Savor Group has multiple venues across Auckland, and is always looking to nuture long term talent.§ §Please send all CV’s through to Joanna@savorgroup.cp.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: PASSIONATE & CARING TEAM LEADER Job in Auckland - SEEK
experience: Applicants must have at least 3 years
xenophobe: We are seeking an experienced, (must have at least four years experience in the residential or commercial property management industry) senior property manager.   Our team is important to us and we  need a team leader who can be collaborative and drive the culture.   You will have excellent skills in leading the team to success.   Success for us is in our team, they are the reason why we have happy clients who achieve good investment results.   We are looking for a person who loves to play on  a team and strives to see all players become become stars.
jobText: TXT/50633166.txt	§PASSIONATE & CARING TEAM LEADER§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§PASSIONATE & CARING TEAM LEADER§§Advertiser: §Erskine & Owen§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$70,000 - $89,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Supervisors/Team Leaders§§§§§§Let it be your time to shine!§ §Point Property and Portfolio Management are a growing and innovative property company. Directing and advising on the management of our clients' property portfolios is a key part of our business. With our sister companies, we are specialists in advice, acquisition and directing of clients' investment portfolios.  We pride ourselves in offering a property management service that goes beyond the basics to take a pro-active and strategic approach in maximising the performance of our clients' portfolios.§ §We are seeking an experienced, (must have at least four years experience in the residential or commercial property management industry) senior property manager.   Our team is important to us and we  need a team leader who can be collaborative and drive the culture.   You will have excellent skills in leading the team to success.   Success for us is in our team, they are the reason why we have happy clients who achieve good investment results.   We are looking for a person who loves to play on  a team and strives to see all players become become stars.§ §You will have sound  knowledge of the RTA and understand  the importance of ensuring new legislation is complied with.  You will support the Operations Director in both internal and external training standards; introduction of new legislation; driving KPI's; maintaining portfolio growth; and be proactive and look for resolutions. § §Managing a small portfolio will come with the role and includes all normal property management duties.    With your experience you know that communication, attention to detail and maintaining processes is the success of a great property manager.§ §We are based in smart new  offices in Newmarket.  A good base salary and a generous commission/bonus structure is offered, along with a company car and carpark.§ §If you are ready for your next challenge and want to work in a progressive company with diverse career opportunities, be a star now and apply to be our Team Leader.§ §Applicants must have at least 3 years work experience in NZ/Australia and hold a NZ drivers licence.§ §Please submit your CV and cover letter via the Seek website for consideration.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Customer Service Representatives, Contact Centre Services, Ellerslie Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681872.txt	§Customer Service Representatives, Contact Centre Services, Ellerslie§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representatives, Contact Centre Services, Ellerslie§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §Customer Service Representatives, Contact Centre Services, Ellerslie §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35036§        §Late November / Early December 2020 start §        §          §Complex, varied work where you get to work on the solution with the client§          §Vibrant and proudly diverse one-team culture §        §        §MSD is an essential service and continues to provide services to support New Zealanders. We are calling for motivated and adaptable people who can hit the ground running and help deliver end to end services for our clients. §        §Now, more than ever, you can make a meaningful difference to the lives of New Zealander’s with our modern and busy contact centre team in Ellerslie.    §        §As a CSR in our Contact Centre you help many clients each day. We will support you to confidently work with clients, primarily through inbound calls and processing applications. You will have the authority to make a real difference in the lives of New Zealanders. You will be responsible for sourcing information and applying it to policy and legislation to make the call about assistance.§        §What we offer§        §We provide a positive and progressive work environment, where we all support each other to achieve excellent outcomes for our clients. You will enjoy an indepth training approach and opportunities to develop your career and an orientation / training plan backed by loads of support.  Our team is renowned for its high quality of training - this often means over time our CSRs are in high demand for progression to other roles in the Ministry.§        §Your hours of work:§        §Your standard hours of work will be 37.55 hours per week, which is seven hours and 35 minutes per day. You will need to be available for 5 days, with 1 of those shifts being Saturday as per the contact centre rotational roster.§        §We work on a no surprises basis and will ensure that you will know your scheduled shifts well in advance.§        §Our general operating hours are:§        §          §Mondays and Fridays, between 6.30am to 6.15pm, and§          §Saturdays between 8.00am and 2.00pm.§        §        §As business demand grows, these hours of operation could change and would be discussed well in advance.§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/contact-centre-services/customer-service-representative-dec-2019.docx§ §        §About you§        § §        §          §You enjoy quality conversations and can demonstrate a history of providing clients a positive experience on the phone.§          §You work efficiently, accurately and can make good decisions.§          §Quick to navigate your way around multiple IT systems you also have an eagerness to learn and desire for self-improvement.§          §You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where frequent change is normal.§          §Salary starts from $46,925.00 per annum.§          §Candidates must hold NZ Citizenship or a Permanent Resident visa at time of application.§        §        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35036§  §Late November / Early December 2020 start § § §Complex, varied work where you get to work on the solution with the client§ §Vibrant and proudly diverse one-team culture § §MSD is an essential service and continues to provide services to support New Zealanders. We are calling for motivated and adaptable people who can hit the ground running and help deliver end to end services for our clients. §  §Now, more than ever, you can make a meaningful difference to the lives of New Zealander’s with our modern and busy contact centre team in Ellerslie.    §  §As a CSR in our Contact Centre you help many clients each day. We will support you to confidently work with clients, primarily through inbound calls and processing applications. You will have the authority to make a real difference in the lives of New Zealanders. You will be responsible for sourcing information and applying it to policy and legislation to make the call about assistance.§  §What we offer§  §We provide a positive and progressive work environment, where we all support each other to achieve excellent outcomes for our clients. You will enjoy an indepth training approach and opportunities to develop your career and an orientation / training plan backed by loads of support.  Our team is renowned for its high quality of training - this often means over time our CSRs are in high demand for progression to other roles in the Ministry.§  §Your hours of work:§  §Your standard hours of work will be 37.55 hours per week, which is seven hours and 35 minutes per day. You will need to be available for 5 days, with 1 of those shifts being Saturday as per the contact centre rotational roster.§  §We work on a no surprises basis and will ensure that you will know your scheduled shifts well in advance.§  §Our general operating hours are:§ § §Mondays and Fridays, between 6.30am to 6.15pm, and§ §Saturdays between 8.00am and 2.00pm.§ §As business demand grows, these hours of operation could change and would be discussed well in advance.§  §Position Description§  §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/contact-centre-services/customer-service-representative-dec-2019.docx§ §  §About you§  § § § §You enjoy quality conversations and can demonstrate a history of providing clients a positive experience on the phone.§ §You work efficiently, accurately and can make good decisions.§ §Quick to navigate your way around multiple IT systems you also have an eagerness to learn and desire for self-improvement.§ §You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where frequent change is normal.§ §Salary starts from $46,925.00 per annum.§ §Candidates must hold NZ Citizenship or a Permanent Resident visa at time of application.§ §Joining us§  §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. jobTitle: Claims Lodgement Consultant Job in Manawatu - SEEK
experience: Since 1905 FMG has been protecting the interests of rural New Zealand. Now over 100 years
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50693045.txt	§Claims Lodgement Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Claims Lodgement Consultant§§Advertiser: §FMG§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§FMG’s Claims Lodgement team constantly exceed client’s expectations and deliver world class service on a daily basis! We’re looking for people with passion, enthusiasm and a commitment to join our Claims Lodgement Team.§As an Lodgement consultant, you will be the voice of FMG and the first point of contact for our clients. You’ll be talking with our customer’s daily - answering queries, problem solving and ensuring we continue to deliver on our promise of ‘providing FMG customer’s with a world class customer service and advice’. This role is more than simply “answering the phone”, with an expectation to gather information gathering from the client, policy response and expectation management being there for our FMG clients when they need us. We are looking for providing outstanding customer service and want to play a key part in an engaged and supportive team§Since 1905 FMG has been protecting the interests of rural New Zealand. Now over 100 years later, we’re still 100% New Zealand owned and the country’s leading rural insurance specialist. As a mutual we invest profits back into the business to keep our premiums competitive for clients. As an employer, we invest in our people to foster a working environment that promotes achievement and celebrates success!§To be successful in this role, you will have:§  §A client focused and professional approach to all tasks;§  §The ability to prioritise, problem solve and juggle multiple priorities;§  §Clear and confident communication skills;§  §A top-notch telephone manner and§  §Strong computer literacy skills.§This is great role to kick-start into a successful insurance career – with FMG providing plenty of opportunities for growth and development. You’ll be provided with full training and support which will ensure you achieve your full potential.§We are recruiting for shifts between the hours of 8.00am – 6.00pm Monday – Friday with some Saturday work required on a rostered basis. This is full time role.§Applications close 5pm, Sunday 18th October 2020. Applications will not be considered without a completed application form.§Please note - the start date of this role is Monday 23rd November 2020.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §Claims-Lodgement-Consultant-PD.doc§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Case Managers - Palmerston North Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670350.txt	§Case Managers - Palmerston North§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Managers - Palmerston North§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§§§§  §    §Case Managers - Palmerston North §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35094§        §Permanent and Fixed Term, full time§        §          §Can you play a key role supporting New Zealanders to achieve their goals?§          §Are you looking for a dynamic, varied role where building relationships is key to success?  §        §        §Case Managers play a vital role in our communities. §        §As a Case Manager, every day is busy and demanding but very rewarding as your work will have a meaningful impact on people's lives.§        §As part of one of our teams, you will work alongside clients to provide support to help improve their lives and enable them to move into employment and other development opportunities. §        §We offer a great work environment, a fabulous team culture and a way to make a real difference to the lives of New Zealanders. §        §It will appeal to highly motivated, adaptable, progressive candidates, who have a strong client-focus and are driven by service excellence and achieving results.  §        §If you are keen to join our team, please apply.  §        §About you§        §Your welcoming approach, Manāakitanga and excellent communication skills will enable you to establish a rapport and get to know and understand how best to support our clients as you work with them to support the achievement of their goals.§        §We are looking for someone who is focused on achievement and can practically help others to access job opportunities, training and development, education programmes and work experience because they understand the labour market, employment and career advisory.   §        §You’ll bring a high level of personal integrity, initiative and relationship management skills to the role. You’ll be comfortable navigating your way around computer systems and enjoy finding solutions to problems. You are curious and like to uncover details, enjoy analysing an issue and using good judgement to solve a problem.§        §If you are focused on achievement and can practically help others to set goals and discover their potential, you will enjoy the challenges and team-work within our Service Centres. §        §You will be well-organised, have good listening skills and an empathic and a non-judgmental approach to serving others.§        §What we offer§        §We will provide you with a positive work environment, where we all support each other to achieve excellent outcomes for our clients. We will also provide great training, support and on-going professional development.§        §Remuneration for this role is from $47,622.00 to $65,480.00 (Range D). Application along this scale is dependent on relevant skills, experience and other factors.§        §How to Apply§        §Please take some time to read over the following position description before applying:§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/4.-client-service-delivery/case-manager-nov-2019.docx§        §          §Current MSD employees: Please apply from a work computer, using your work myHR login.  A current CV and cover letter is required.§          §All external applicants - please apply through the apply button and upload your CV and cover letter to our applicant tracking system.  Please note all applications must be made online.§        §        §You will be prompted to answer the following questions in the application form:§        §          §Why do you want to be a Case Manager?§          §If you were a Case Manager, how do you think you would help people on their journey to employment?  §        §        §Applications close: 13 October 2020.§        §For any further discussion about the role, contact Alison van Echten on §Alison.vanechten005@msd.govt.nz§  §        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35094§ §Permanent and Fixed Term, full time§ § §Can you play a key role supporting New Zealanders to achieve their goals?§ §Are you looking for a dynamic, varied role where building relationships is key to success?  § §Case Managers play a vital role in our communities. § §As a Case Manager, every day is busy and demanding but very rewarding as your work will have a meaningful impact on people's lives.§ §As part of one of our teams, you will work alongside clients to provide support to help improve their lives and enable them to move into employment and other development opportunities. § §We offer a great work environment, a fabulous team culture and a way to make a real difference to the lives of New Zealanders. § §It will appeal to highly motivated, adaptable, progressive candidates, who have a strong client-focus and are driven by service excellence and achieving results.  § §If you are keen to join our team, please apply.  § §About you§ §Your welcoming approach, Manāakitanga and excellent communication skills will enable you to establish a rapport and get to know and understand how best to support our clients as you work with them to support the achievement of their goals.§ §We are looking for someone who is focused on achievement and can practically help others to access job opportunities, training and development, education programmes and work experience because they understand the labour market, employment and career advisory.   § §You’ll bring a high level of personal integrity, initiative and relationship management skills to the role. You’ll be comfortable navigating your way around computer systems and enjoy finding solutions to problems. You are curious and like to uncover details, enjoy analysing an issue and using good judgement to solve a problem.§ §If you are focused on achievement and can practically help others to set goals and discover their potential, you will enjoy the challenges and team-work within our Service Centres. § §You will be well-organised, have good listening skills and an empathic and a non-judgmental approach to serving others.§ §What we offer§ §We will provide you with a positive work environment, where we all support each other to achieve excellent outcomes for our clients. Application along this scale is dependent on relevant skills, experience and other factors.§ §How to Apply§ §Please take some time to read over the following position description before applying:§ §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/4.-client-service-delivery/case-manager-nov-2019.docx§ § §Current MSD employees: Please apply from a work computer, using your work myHR login.  A current CV and cover letter is required.§ §All external applicants - please apply through the apply button and upload your CV and cover letter to our applicant tracking system.  Please note all applications must be made online.§ §You will be prompted to answer the following questions in the application form:§ § §Why do you want to be a Case Manager?§ §If you were a Case Manager, how do you think you would help people on their journey to employment?  § §Applications close: 13 October 2020.§ §For any further discussion about the role, contact Alison van Echten on §Alison.vanechten005@msd.govt.nz§  § §Joining us§ §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. And you'll work closely with our sales and technical teams to empower clients to maximize the benefits of our products and services.§        §In any given day you'll:§        §          §Fielding inbound calls and emails direct from external and internal customers.§          §Resolving a variety of order/quote related cases and enquiries.§          §Providing first-tier technical support.§          §Influence process improvements to increase customer satisfaction.§        §        §Work with an industry leader§        §SICK has pioneered a long line of industry firsts – such as the first safety light curtain, the first colour sensor, and many more. These innovations provide solutions to virtually every industry application. Our team is growing and we are seeking a confident, articulate person with a strong background in customer service to join our bright, tight-knit customer service team. The position is based in our Auckland office but will support our customers across all of New Zealand and in Australia.§        §How we help you make the most of your skills§        §We provide a comprehensive induction program as well as full training on our processes and product ranges. This includes managing cases in Dynamics CRM / SAP and getting direct training from our Product Managers and through the SICK Online University platform.§        §What you need to bring to the table§        §If you have a positive and constructive attitude, nous to quickly pick up our product portfolio and go that extra mile to deliver outstanding customer service, we are looking for you. In addition you will have:§        §          §Customer service or inside sales experience§. You know how to work with customers to give and provide information needed to resolve customer requirements. A resume glowing with outstanding references and applicable experience will go a long way to securing this role.§          §Teamwork mindset.§ The success of the team is strongly linked to the ability for the individuals to work and have fun together.§          §Strong verbal and written communication skills.§ A professional and clear communication style comes natural to you.§          §Critical thinker.§ You have a passion for learning about products/systems and can articulate complex issues simply.§          §Computer experience.§ You know your way around MS Office (especially Outlook, Word, and Excel). Experience with SAP or Dymanics CRM also highly desirable.§          §Flexibility.§ Willing and able to adapt with the changing requirements of the business.§        §        §The benefits to you§        §This is the perfect position for a bright, articulate person with experience in phone sales or customer service.§        §Our team has huge ambitions. If you're happy to roll your sleeves up and advance your career, you'll enjoy being part of a fun, skilled team in an open-minded and entrepreneurial company that's passionate about customer service.§        §If we still have your attention, here's how to apply§        §1. Prepare a cover letter that demonstrates how your experience is applicable.§        §2. Submit and complete these items via the application process, or via the e-mail address below§        §A new and rewarding career is waiting for you! §        §NOTE: §Candidates will be required to possess valid work rights for New Zealand.§      §      §matthew.huntington@sick.com.au§ §    §  §§§"SICK is one team with many voices; that is accountable for it's continuous improvements, innovation and ability to deliver a seamless customer experience."§ §The opportunity!§ §You'll respond to client cases and recommend solutions. These innovations provide solutions to virtually every industry application. Our team is growing and we are seeking a confident, articulate person with a strong background in customer service to join our bright, tight-knit customer service team. The position is based in our Auckland office but will support our customers across all of New Zealand and in Australia.§ §How we help you make the most of your skills§ §We provide a comprehensive induction program as well as full training on our processes and product ranges. This includes managing cases in Dynamics CRM / SAP and getting direct training from our Product Managers and through the SICK Online University platform.§ §What you need to bring to the table§ §If you have a positive and constructive attitude, nous to quickly pick up our product portfolio and go that extra mile to deliver outstanding customer service, we are looking for you. In addition you will have:§ § §Customer service or inside sales experience§. You know how to work with customers to give and provide information needed to resolve customer requirements. A resume glowing with outstanding references and applicable experience will go a long way to securing this role.§ §Teamwork mindset.§ The success of the team is strongly linked to the ability for the individuals to work and have fun together.§ §Strong verbal and written communication skills.§ A professional and clear communication style comes natural to you.§ §Critical thinker.§ You have a passion for learning about products/systems and can articulate complex issues simply.§ §Computer experience.§ You know your way around MS Office (especially Outlook, Word, and Excel). Experience with SAP or Dymanics CRM also highly desirable.§ §Flexibility.§ Willing and able to adapt with the changing requirements of the business.§ §The benefits to you§ §This is the perfect position for a bright, articulate person with experience in phone sales or customer service.§ §Our team has huge ambitions. Prepare a cover letter that demonstrates how your experience is applicable.§ §2. This is a pivotal role for the Ministry. The responsibilities of Support Officers help the courts operate timely and effectively.§As a Court Registry Support Officer your day will involve you engaging with our customers, including Lawyers, Judges, and the public - whether it be over the phone or face to face. You'll work closely with Court Registry Officers and support them while they take Court and manage case files.§This is a permanent full-time position.§Day to day you will be responsible for:§§Providing timely and efficient customer service;§Supporting Judges and Court Registry Officers both in and out of the courtroom;§Supporting jurors for trial hearings;§Providing general administrative support for Court Registry Officers, including photocopying, scanning and filing;§Managing the incoming and outgoing mail§Managing evidence exhibits;§Accounts payable, and;§Data entry.§§Mō te tīma/About our Team§At Tāhū o te Ture - the Ministry of Justice, we're committed to working together for a fair and safe Aotearoa.§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§To be successful in this role you will have proven customer service experience. You will need to be confident, able to multi task, flexible and adapt to change with ease. You'll also enjoy a challenge and be motivated to learn..§Tono mai/How to Apply§The salary range for this position is $43,016 - $54,336. Starting salaries are generally between $43,000 and $45,280 and are dependent on skills and experience.§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description here, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§Applications close on 21 October 2020. §If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§

You will also be responsible for utilising a range of multimedia communication tools to manage enquiries, and empower customers by providing online, self-help options, and undertake other administrative duties.§        §For this role, you will have;§        §          §Minimum of 3 years work experience, preferably in a customer service environment.§          §Willingness to work overnight and/or weekend/public holiday shifts§          §Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, including the ability to relay technical information to customers in a way that is easily understood§          §A "can do" solution focus in customer interactions, always going the extra mile when possible to ensure customers get the best possible service.§          §Proven ability to learn technical information across a broad range of subjects.§          §Demonstrated problem solving and judgement skills§          §Strong work ethic and able to effectively manage multiple priorities and adapt to change within a changing business environment§          §Local government is preferred but not required§          §NCEA Level 3 or University Entrance equivalent§        §        §If you are looking to take on a new challenge and have the right skills and experience for the role, then we would love to hear from you - Apply Now.§        §For more information, refer to the detailed position description attached.§        §Applications close on Friday 23 October 2020.§      §      §      §    §    §To apply for this job, please go to our website§ www.tauranga.govt.nz/careers§  §§§Hours - 1.30pm-6.00pm 22.5 hours a week, Monday to Friday.§Tauranga is on a journey to become a talented and innovative city full of opportunity, a city with heart and soul; and a city of great spaces, places and environments and with all of this on the horizon. Home to top class restaurants and bars, excellent beaches, high quality schools and an enviable range of events all complemented by abundant sunshine and a great community.§Our Contact Centre team is part of the People & Engagement department, and successfully operates 24/7 throughout the year. We are looking for an exceptional §Contact Centre Advisor§ to join our friendly, collaborative and dynamic team! You are the first point of contact for phone and email enquiries received through Council's Contact Centre. This is an important role in the business that provides our customers with expert and accurate advice and enables our Business Units throughout Council to provide excellent service. This includes managing a range of enquiries such as bylaw queries, building and property information, general planning, animal control and rates information. You will also be responsible for utilising a range of multimedia communication tools to manage enquiries, and empower customers by providing online, self-help options, and undertake other administrative duties.§For this role, you will have;§Minimum of 3 years work experience, preferably in a customer service environment.§Willingness to work overnight and/or weekend/public holiday shifts§Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, including the ability to relay technical information to customers in a way that is easily understood§A "can do" solution focus in customer interactions, always going the extra mile when possible to ensure customers get the best possible service.§Proven ability to learn technical information across a broad range of subjects.§Demonstrated problem solving and judgement skills§Strong work ethic and able to effectively manage multiple priorities and adapt to change within a changing business environment§Local government is preferred but not required§NCEA Level 3 or University Entrance equivalent§If you are looking to take on a new challenge and have the right skills and experience for the role, then we would love to hear from you - Apply Now.§For more information, refer to the detailed position description attached.§Applications close on Friday 23 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50584849.txt	§Online Customer Service Superstar Required§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Online Customer Service Superstar Required§§Advertiser: §Adult Toy Mega Store§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§You could get a regular customer service job… Or you could join the fun-loving team at Adulttoymegastore.co.nz where there's no such thing as a boring day!§We're BIG on customer care here at ATMS – you only need to read our online testimonials to see how seriously we take good service. We’re growing and so too is our Customer Satisfaction team. That's why we're looking for another §customer service mega star§ to join our team based in the Wellington CBD.§Adulttoymegastore.co.nz has become the biggest online retailer for adult toys in New Zealand, and now we deliver to Australia, USA, Canada and the UK too. We have grown in leaps and bounds, and it’s all because we have a great team, and hire great people. We're local, owned and operated here in Wellington - come join us!§What we'll need from you§- Your great communication skills and dedication to good service will mean our customers love shopping at ATMS - even when the odd thing doesn't go quite to plan, you'll make sure everything gets put right.§- You'll be a multi-tasker like no other – working efficiently to finish that email, process that return and answer that phone call – all before you've had your breakfast!§- You'll make a great ambassador for our brand – you'll represent the face, voice and values of our company with our customers.§- Your mature and positive attitude to sex will mean our customers always feel comfortable getting in touch.§  §- While this is a largely online email based role, you'll be just as confident over the phone or with face-to-face customer service when we take ATMS on the road to expos and events.§  §-You will be available to work 40 hours per week, including some shifts on Saturdays and Sundays in the busy periods (these can be completed remotely from home)§What you'll get in return§- A supportive working environment where your development will be a priority. Our people are important to us, so there's always lots of opportunities to try different tasks and learn new skills.§- Good work-life balance. We work (very!) hard, but we play hard too. We have a high-performance culture so we like to have fun and celebrate our wins along the way.§- A really decent coffee machine so you can whizz through those customer emails at an impressive caffeine-induced pace§- Some pretty great work stories. Yep, the adult toy world can definitely be eye-opening but we have a very open-minded, fun-loving approach to our little industry and no two days are ever the same!§  § §  § §  §To apply please §  §1. Create a short 60 sec video (on your phone is fine) showing us you have what it takes and send through via a direct message to our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/loveatms/§  §2. §Upload a CV covering your CSR experience.§  §3. Upload a tailor-made covering letter outlining why you think you have what it takes to join our ATMS Customer Care team§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have as a customer services representative?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50580007.txt	§Customer Care Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Care Manager§§Advertiser: §Airwork NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Salary§§$85,000 - $109,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Management & Support§§§§§§About the role:§ §We are looking for a Customer Care Manager who is quick-thinking and solutions-focussed and provides a refreshing and positive experience to our internal and external customers. This role requires a leader who is passionate about developing others and delivering successful customer outcomes.  You’ll have a strong customer centric focus, be someone that is patient, empathetic and happy to work through options with customers to find the best solutions. You must be able to work in flexible work environment that caters to different time zones.  You'll join a great team, who knows how to have fun as well as work hard.§ §Our Company:§ §Airwork NZ (AWNZ) is a globally recognised helicopter engineering, sales and leasing company based at Ardmore Airport with bases globally. The company has a comprehensive range of capabilities, in-house expertise, world class technology and certifications that distinguishes them within the global aviation market.§ §Airwork’s first priority is safety in everything we do.  This role must work across the wider team to ensure that all maintenance activities are safe and build a culture of commitment to safety. We have a highly engaged workforce through great people, practices and excellent career and training opportunities and offer a competitive salary. We pride ourselves on having a great work life balance.  Our asset is our people and their passion for their industry.§ § §Responsibilities will include:§ § §Responsible for ensuring that AWNZ’s clients and stakeholders receive a high-quality customer experience, driving an increase in parts sales and increasing revenues in the external ASP programme. § §Full ownership of customer issues and for following problems through to resolution.§ §Responsible for ensuring that the workflow of customer jobs is meeting and exceeding their expectations with regular updates provided.§ §Responsible for ensuring that the customer experience continually improves and is effective at engaging customers, supporting sustainable growth of the AWNZ business§ §Responsible for managing and growing the Airwork Support Plan (ASP) business§ §Provision of first-class technical assistance and product/service advice§ §Act as an information advisor, providing customers and colleagues across the business key information to enable business success§ §Provide pricing and availability information, cross-reference, research & source of products for customers and sales thereof§ §Where required make proactive outbound calls in line with marketing campaigns, quotes follow-up etc§ §Proactively inform the Sales & Leasing Team of potential product /leasing etc leads§ §Build and maintain effective relationships with internal and external customers§ § §What we are looking for:§ § §Proven management and customer service experience§ §Focused and driven to provide quality customer outcomes§ §Proven ability to lead a team§ §Approachable with good interpersonal skills, accompanied with a positive and friendly personality§ §Excellent verbal communication skills, with an exceptional phone manner, and strong listening skills§ §Ability to multitask and handle pressure§ §Able to remain calm in challenging situations§ §High degree of computer literacy, including intermediate working knowledge of Microsoft based programmes (database experience would be an advantage)§ §Accurate and efficient data entry skills§ §If you believe you tick all the boxes, then apply now!§ §This position should have valid New Zealand working rights.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a care manager?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

opportunities, offer loads of development and insight about the Warehouse Group business with some good fun and laughs along the way. This is Te Tumu Paeroa, guardian, support and advancer of the mana of Māori land everywhere. §        § §        §It is an exciting time for our organisation. We also work an occasional Saturday (penal rates apply).§        §Why is Bowel Screening Important?§        §Every year, more than 3000 New Zealanders are diagnosed with bowel cancer and more than 1200 die from it.§        §Māori are more likely than non-Māori to die from bowel cancer, partly because Māori are more likely to be diagnosed with bowel cancer at an advanced stage when it is more difficult to treat.§        §This free National Bowel Screening Programme aims to save lives by detecting bowel cancer at an early stage, when it can often be successfully treated and has a focus on initiatives that drive equitable participation for all population groups.§        §How does Bowel Screening save lives?§        §International evidence shows that bowel screening programmes can save lives through early diagnosis and treatment of bowel cancer. There may be no warning signs that bowel cancer is developing. Where cancers are diagnosed through services that treat people who already have symptoms of bowel cancer, only about 40% are found at an early stage.§        §Bowel Screening has health, social and economic benefits. Early identification and treatment results in better outcomes for those with bowel cancer and lower treatment costs when compared to the cost of treating more advanced cancers.§        §A bowel screening programme that has equal screening and follow-up rates for Māori and non-Māori could reduce inequities through early diagnosis and treatment.§        §The National Bowel Screening Programme has a focus on driving initiatives that support equitable participation for all population groups.§      §      §      §    §  §§§If you have the skills set, we are looking for, and speak Te Reo or a Pacific language, apply now.§Due to an internal promotion(s) we are now looking for Service Coordinators to join our team to provide service support to the National Bowel Screening Programme Register team.§A big focus of this role is to take calls and make calls to people to ensure that they receive the test kits and support they need to complete these. There may be no warning signs that bowel cancer is developing. Where cancers are diagnosed through services that treat people who already have symptoms of bowel cancer, only about 40% are found at an early stage.§Bowel Screening has health, social and economic benefits. jobText: TXT/50702830.txt	§Trade Counter Sales- Fixed Term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Trade Counter Sales- Fixed Term§§Advertiser: §Carrier New Zealand Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§About the business§ §AHI Carrier (NZ) Limited is an international multi-discipline company active in a wide range of HVAC based equipment sales, installation, and service work with a nationwide presence. Our New Zealand business streams includes the sale of new equipment (including Carrier and Toshiba Heat Pumps), Spare parts through our Totaline stores and Service work.§ §Totaline Stores provide specialist products for the air-conditioning, heating and refrigeration trade providing our customers with a choice of aftermarket solutions nationally through our network of trade outlets located strategically across New Zealand.§ § § §We are currently seeking an experienced §Trade Counter Sales§person for our Auckland store, with trade sales and warehousing experience for a §fixed term§ to replace staff on maternity leave until mid-June 2021. Reporting to the Branch Manager, the overall responsibility of this role will focus on servicing and assisting customers with their HVAC parts and supplies, aiming to achieve exceptional customer satisfaction and promoting Totaline as their preferred one-stop-shop for all their after-market needs. Additionally, you will also have shared warehousing responsibility so warehousing experience would be beneficial.§ §A normal business day will include, but not limited to, interacting with trade customers, expediting sales orders & branch transfers, dealing with customers face to face and on the phone, sourcing parts, raising invoices, merchandising of stock, working with the team to improve branch results by building strong relationships with customers. You will also focus on developing new business initiatives through your business networks, aiming to build new customer base. As part of the team you will also be required to handle warehouse responsibilities, forming part of the store, that includes sorting, picking and packing goods, labelling, storing and other tasks as required by the Branch Manager.§ §Candidates with exceptional customer & communication skills, and computer proficiency with ERP & MS365 programs would be a minimum criterion you need, to be considered for the role. Preference will be given to applicants who have prior trade counter sales or HVAC&R, Electrical, Mechanical experience plus warehousing knowledge and holds a forklift license. § §Benefits and perks§ §We offer a competitive salary, a chance to work with an industry leading company and within a great working environment.§ §Skills and experience§ §This role requires a team player with a positive can-do attitude, attention to detail and willingness to learn & grow with exceptional customer service as your number one priority.§ §Computer literacy with ERP systems and MS programs with be a distinct advantage.§ §Only NZ citizens & residents or with persons with valid NZ work permit need to apply.§ §Apply in confidence through SEEK.§ §To apply for this role please email:§Nirmal.Gaunder@ahi-carrier.co.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50599619.txt	§Customer Operations Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Operations Advisor§§Advertiser: §Canterbury of New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Salary§§Base, clothing allowance and other buying benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§About Us§ §Canterbury of New Zealand was established back in 1904 when John Lane, Pringle Walker and Alfred Rudkin began producing woollen garments deep in the Canterbury Province of New Zealand.  Before long, they were making uniforms for the army during the First World War, and they earned themselves a reputation for manufacturing tough, durable kit.  So much so, the legendary All Blacks rugby team approached them to produce rugby attire in which they could play. § §The rest as they say is history; Canterbury of New Zealand outfitted the All Blacks team for over 75 years and is now the largest dedicated rugby brand in the world.  Canterbury currently supplies kit to numerous high-profile national teams; England Rugby, Ireland Rugby, British & Irish Lions, Australian Rugby league as well as leading clubs such as NZ Vodafone Warriors, Canterbury Bankstown Bulldogs, NSW State of Origin, Leinster and Bath Rugby including a number of NPC sides.§ §About the Role§ §This is a highly administrative Customer Operations Advisor role working across a range of sales channels.  Although your role will be focused on our Wholesale customers, you will also be cross trained in Teamwear and Credits/Returns as part of collaborative team that supports each other through the busy periods and provide cover for leave.§ §As the key conduit between our customers and the supply process you will be responsible for high volume order processing and administration of customer accounts.   No doubt about this, it is a busy role requiring strong administrative skills.§ §Your day to day includes§ § §First point of contact for our customers across the ANZ region§ §Process customer orders through our phone, web and email queues for multiple sales channels§ §Processing customer returns and credits§ §Provide pricing and delivery information§ §Provide prompt customer service and issue resolution§ §Escalate unresolved issues to appropriate departments§ §Providing Sales Support to our reps in relation to their customer accounts§ §Responding to social media channels§ §And more….§ §Our business has evolved significantly over the last two years with the introduction of new online systems, automating ways of working etc however some of our systems still require administrative support.§ §About You§ §You’ll be used to working in a fast pact customer focused environment and able to manage multiple tasks across different sales channels.  Your skills will include§ § §Fast and accurate data entry§ §Advanced Excel skills and intermediate on other Microsoft Office products§ §Excellent organisational skills along with attention to detail§ §Ability to multi-task and prioritise workloads§ §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills§ §A hard working, motivated team player§ §A problem solver with good analytical skills§ §Sense of urgency§ §Effective in negotiation and communication (both verbal and written)§ §What’s on Offer§ §As an iconic kiwi brand our name is a household name.  Whilst you don’t have to be a sports buff to work here, an interest in the industry is an advantage.§ §We are a close-knit team of business professionals who work hard but love a good laugh and a shared lunch.§ §In addition to your salary we provide a uniform allowance to wear our brand, discounted products across Canterbury products and other brands from within the Pentland group, onsite parking in Avondale and other perks including the odd game day ticket (when we are allowed out!)§ §How to apply§ §Please apply via Seek with your current CV.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50595644.txt	§Shopify Support Advisor (Customer Service Representative)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Shopify Support Advisor (Customer Service Representative)§§Advertiser: §Shopify§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Fixed salary of $51,000 + perks§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Kia Ora! The work of a Shopify Support Advisor is incredibly rewarding and equally challenging. Our merchants have amazing stories filled with highs and lows, frustrations, and triumphs. It is in these moments and many in between that you would make an impact.§ §As an Advisor, you’ll work remotely from the comfort of your home while working within a dynamic, diverse and supportive environment. You won’t always know the answers to the questions you’re being asked, so your ability to be resourceful is key! We believe in human-centred, high-quality customer experiences. Using chats, phone calls and emails, you’ll be there to listen, teach, problem solve and explore growth opportunities with Shopify merchants. As part of that growth, you’ll be there to connect merchants with potential new features or plans to ensure they get the most out of the Shopify platform. § §If you’re up for the challenge and enjoy working in a high-pressure environment, we encourage you to apply and take part in a hiring process that will allow you to meet folks at Shopify and get a taste for what the job entails. We aim to provide you with as much information about the role early in the process so that you know what to expect throughout, and in your first few months.§ §Following 4 weeks of training and 2 weeks of mentoring, you will begin responding to our merchants on live channels as part of a small squad, who is there to support you. All Advisors work a combination of weekdays, weekends and holidays in a full-time capacity. § §We believe in supportive teams, an inclusive work environment and providing growth opportunities within your role. We also work remotely - which means you get to be part of a fast-growing global tech company from the comfort of your home.§ §Even if you’ve never held a similar position but you’re interested so far and relate to the things we’ve outlined below, we want to hear from you! § §Responsibilities:§ §Adhering to a daily schedule that includes a mix of: Phones, three (3) simultaneous chats, and emails.§Ensuring merchants have a quick response time by staying on top of your assigned tickets, with same-day ticket review.§Acting as a business coach and thinking about the merchant’s business holistically when offering solutions.§Completing essential follow-up documentation after each interaction.§Engaging in human conversations with merchants to identify and resolve issues, and provide coaching/growth opportunities for their businesses.§Offer needs-based solutions, not pushy sales.§Advocating for merchants and the Shopify platform by communicating with stakeholders.§Owning your own development through reflection, reviewing past interactions and preparing to discuss growth opportunities with your lead in regular 1:1 meetings.§ §Requirements for the role:§ §Live and have legal authorization to work in New Zealand.§Extensive experience providing exceptional customer service in a contact centre, retail or service environment.§Have appropriate remote work set-up - such as quiet space, stable internet connection, and a back-up location in case of issues with the primary location.§Have access to a wired internet speed of at least 25 Mbps download speed and 10 Mbps upload. You can check your speed here.§The hours that we are currently hiring for are set to be a rotating schedule with varying 8-hour shifts starting anytime between 7:00 am - 11:00 am in your local timezone. This means some days your shifts could be as early as 7am-3pm, and as late as 11am-7pm. You would have notice well in advance for your scheduled times, and the idea would be to have them as consistent as possible, but due to varying needs we do require full availability. This would also include rotating weekend shifts.§Proven track record of being incredibly resourceful and finding solutions even when there is no clear path.§Ability to adapt to new processes and work accurately in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment.§Proficiency with technology paired with excellent typing skills.§Have strong reading, writing and communication skills.§Willingness to learn all about entrepreneurship, care deeply about people support and enjoy having genuine human conversations.§Possess high level of understanding, patience and empathy. Able to navigate more difficult conversations/interactions with professionalism.§Are committed to continuous growth and learning. You understand that every challenge is an opportunity and you get excited about learning new things.§Ensure privacy and security practices are followed at all times for both merchants and Shopify.§ §Bonus experience:§ §A background or interest in business, marketing, retail, or sales.§Ran or had exposure to running a business or being an entrepreneur.§ §At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.§ §If your experience is §this§ close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying. Experience comes in many forms – skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.§ §Join a world-class team§ §PLEASE APPLY DIRECTLY on our careers page through this link: https://jobs.lever.co/shopify/4490db27-9d2f-483e-abeb-0bc25a4b2194?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=Seek§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50577771.txt	§Customer Service - Manukau§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service - Manukau§§Advertiser: §Hynds§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Customer Service - Manukau §    §      §      §      §        §          §Frontline Customer Focused Role§          §Join a high-performing team§          §Busy Ormiston Road Branch Location§        §        §The role:§        §We are seeking a team player to provide exceptional customer service to our clients within the civil, water, wastewater and drainage industries. Responsibilities will include front counter sales, phone enquiries, customer service, stock control, sales and quotes, assisting with deliveries and the loading/unloading of customer vehicles, and the general operations within our busy Manukau branch. This is normally a Monday to Friday role with rostered Saturday work.§        §What you will bring to Hynds:§        §          §Previous front line / front counter customer service experience in a similar environment or industry§          §Knowledge of our products and how they work is advantageous§          §A keen interest in our industry§          §Good level of computer literacy§          §Current full driver's license§          §A Forklift license (F endorsement) or ability to gain immediately§          §Excellent verbal and written communication skills - demonstrate high levels of professionalism and attention to detail§          §You will be self-confident and you will be able to approach and engage with customers§          §A reasonable level of physical fitness.§        §        §Why join Hynds:§        §          §Competitive salary§          §Southern Cross medical cover§          §Values focused and supportive environment§          §Ongoing learning & development opportunities§        §        §Who we are:§        §Founded in 1973, Hynds is New Zealand's premier product supplier for the management of water and water-based waste in the civil and rural infrastructure markets. Hynds remains proudly family-owned and has built its reputation on customer service and innovation.§        §We are committed as a team to helping our customers succeed and believe in the Hynds Values to guide the way. Hynds is a place where people matter, where we do what's right and where we connect with our customers.§        §Pre-employment checks:§        §Hynds are committed to high levels of health and safety. Our role is to help New Zealand businesses build strategic alliances and develop commercial relationships internationally.§      § Through a global network of 45 offices, we connect New Zealand businesses with the world, sharing opportunities, knowledge, experience and networks.§    §    §      §Customer Manager - Pou Arahi - Māori Business §      §      §      §        §Kia hiwa ra, kia hiwa ra!!§Ka tangi te tītī, ka tangi te kākā, ka tangi hoki āhau§§        §Te Taurapa Tūhono - NZTE is increasing the number of businesses we work with to grow internationally. jobText: TXT/50645983.txt	§Customer Manager - Pou Arahi - Māori Business§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Manager - Pou Arahi - Māori Business§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Trade & Enterprise§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Management & Support§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §NZTE is New Zealand's international business development agency. Our role is to help New Zealand businesses build strategic alliances and develop commercial relationships internationally.§      § Through a global network of 45 offices, we connect New Zealand businesses with the world, sharing opportunities, knowledge, experience and networks.§    §    §      §Customer Manager - Pou Arahi - Māori Business §      §      §      §        §Kia hiwa ra, kia hiwa ra!!§Ka tangi te tītī, ka tangi te kākā, ka tangi hoki āhau§§        §Te Taurapa Tūhono - NZTE is increasing the number of businesses we work with to grow internationally. We have a strong commitment to growing the number of Māori export businesses we work with.§        §To support this we have three fantastic opportunities in our Māori customer team based in Tāmaki Makaurau and Te Whanganui-a-Tara. We are looking for Customer Managers to join our high performing team of committed and dedicated people, where you can use your Māori and commercial "know how" and "know who" to grow Māori businesses internationally - bigger, better and faster for the good of Aotearoa New Zealand.§        §Who we are§        §Te Taurapa Tūhono - NZTE is New Zealand's international business development agency. Existing for one purpose - to grow New Zealand businesses internationally. Our Customer Manager roles require you to develop strong relationships with a diverse portfolio of Māori customers across a number of sectors including agritech, technology, food and beverage, manufacturing and fashion. §        §What you'll be doing§        §We are looking for Customer Managers to create true partnerships with our Māori customers based in Tāmaki Makaurau and Te Whanganui-a-Tara. You'll work intensively with them to deeply understand their business - their challenges and opportunities, and their international growth strategy, and build a work programme together to help them achieve their goals.Additionally, you will need the ability to be a problem solver and connect your customers to the right experts to address challenges and raise opportunities.§        §What you'll need to be successful§        §Understanding Māori businesses is a core component of the role. This combined with your strong commercial acumen (preferably gained with export businesses), and a proven ability to deliver results will be support you to be successful in the role. Building relationships across the NZTE and NZ Inc network is an important part of what we do, along with Māori customer growth success. You will understand the context for Māori business, be confident in working with Māori businesses, their shareholders and owners. You will have the ability to build relationships inside and outside of Māoridom. You will be enthusiastic, a strong communicator and have the ability to not only build rapport but develop strong and trusted relationships. Your ability to work independently and connect with the broader NZTE team will be paramount. You will be proud of your skill sets and have the ability to grow others through sharing your knowledge of Māori culture, people and business for Māori customer growth success. You will also have a willingness to learn from others.§        §You will possess passion and energy to help regional businesses succeed on the global stage. You will be customer centric, where you understand the customer's opportunities and challenges. This will be done by connecting to our customers with empathy, credibility and commercial reality.§        §An understanding of and experience in tech and food and beverage sectors is a benefit, particularly in start-up and growth.§        §Why you'll love working here§        §You will be exposed to an array of businesses across different sectors. You will be joining a commercially astute team who learn from each other's depth of experience and have strong commitment to lifting New Zealand's economic performance. Not only will you be a part of a team of 700 across the globe, you will be part of our specialist Māori Business Team - Te Pora Māori. Te Pora Māori is a dispersed team based in NZ and Internationally, who champion the success of Māori exporting business through investment opportunities, strategic relationships and capability uplift.§        §What's next§        §If you are passionate about assisting Māori businesses to grow bigger, better, faster internationally, and have an adventurous spirit that enjoys challenges and complex work, we'd love to hear from you - apply now!§        §Applications close at 5.00pm on Sunday, 11 October 2020.§        §We believe New Zealand is good for the world.  A country embracing its diverse landscapes and people. At NZTE it's all about the people. We work flexibly at NZTE and we're keen to talk to you about what that might mean for you in this role.  We're deeply connected to the diversity of our people across the globe and embrace how that drives our organisation and the country forward. §      §    §    §FOR MORE INFORMATION about NZTE and this role please visit https://www.nzte.govt.nz/about/careers/jobs/§ Date: §  §§§Kia hiwa ra, kia hiwa ra!!§Ka tangi te tītī, ka tangi te kākā, ka tangi hoki āhau§§Te Taurapa Tūhono - NZTE is increasing the number of businesses we work with to grow internationally. You will be responsible for the efficient and profitable operation of the store in line with company strategy and values, and you will work with the wider team in the region to grow our market share and business presence in the community.§Administration, compliance, inventory and staff management are also important parts of this role, so you'll be computer savvy with strong oral, written and interpersonal skills. You will be highly organised and enjoy working in an autonomous environment dealing with a wide range of customers and colleagues.§Duties and responsibilities:§Identify and pursue opportunities for growth with existing and potential clients§Complete required store administration and inventory management processes in line with approved company procedures§Prepare, submit and monitor annual sales budgets for your store§Provide effective management of the store team including coaching, appraisals and individual and team development.§Skills and experience:§Proven leadership, management and sales skills preferably in a retail environment§New Zealand agricultural sector knowledge, experience and technical expertise§Excellent level of oral and written communication and be able to relate well to your team and our customers§A background in administration and inventory management§A full, current NZ driver's licence.§Apply today!§To discuss this opportunity further, please contact Andrew Gillam, Retail Sales Manager on 027 556 6606.§Apply now or to find out more about working at PGG Wrightson or view other opportunities visit https://careers.pggwrightson.co.nz/search and enter reference number 15686SK§Applications close on Sunday, 25 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50586974.txt	§Customer Support Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Support Team Leader§§Advertiser: §Mission Labs Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Supervisors/Team Leaders§§§§§§ABOUT US§Mission Labs is a fast-moving and fast-growing tech company. We're using modern technologies and new ways of working to rethink and develop solutions for the telecoms industry. The way that people communicate and the tools they use are evolving; we’re proud to create innovative products of the future which improve the digital customer experience.§With the likes of JD, Capita and the National Trust as clients, it might not seem like we are a startup. But we are very much a startup. §At Mission Labs you can expect to become part of a fast paced and rewarding environment mixed with plenty of fun and laughs thrown in for good measure. We continuously challenge ourselves and our ways of working. Whether using the latest tech to push what we think is possible, collaborating on new business proposals or working on a tight deadline fuelled by Pizza - there’s never a dull moment here.§With successful year on year growth in the UK, we’re now on an exciting trajectory with a vision to bring the future forward faster.  §THE ROLE§We’re on the look-out for an inspiring and energetic Team Leader to build our small dynamic CircleLoop team in Wellington, New Zealand.§This role and location is a first for us, and you will be able to help shape the team, culture and grow with us - including helping us find a location for the office!  This is an excellent career opportunity within a fast growing, forward thinking industry.§What you will be doing §Your responsibility will be to lead and develop a team of Customer Support Executives, inspiring them to deliver the best service possible and challenge the norm.  This is very much a hands on role, providing training, coaching, development and general office management in order to help us grow within the New Zealand market.  You won’t be afraid to roll your sleeves up - from developing programs and procedures to enhance team performance, liaising with the software engineers to improve the product, to jumping on the phones and speaking with customers alongside your team.  Key Responsibilities include:§Developing inventive processes to power the department forward and drive productivity, always with customer satisfaction at the forefront§Prioritising, progressing and monitoring your team’s support tickets and requests to ensure they are resolved within the agreed timescales.§Coach, train and develop the team around you to ensure the highest standards of customer service are always provided to our customers§Scheduling the team to ensure that adequate resource is in place to cover the core customer facing hours§Deal with customer ticket escalations on behalf of the team, providing coaching where applicable§Prioritising, progressing and monitoring porting tickets and porting requests to ensure they are processed within the agreed timescales. The ability to communicate with a range of external partners and report back to our customers is vital.§Build long-lasting relationships with CircleLoop customers and partners - so that customers will love speaking with the team!§Use our CRM and sales support software tools including Hubspot and our internal CRM Super to assist customers and utilise these to enhance the customers or partners experience§Liaise with our UK team to establish best practices and enhance knowledge§Lead the team to work together on achieving KPI targets and help the business grow!§Who we’re on the lookout for§To be successful in this role you will have great customer service experience to boot, but of course have exceptional leadership skills that allow you to influence and build great working relationships with your team.  You will have a knack for problem solving, motivating others and be especially tech savvy.§You need to be confident, assertive and inspiring - success in this role is about building a great team who our customers love speaking to!§Our new and existing customers will love speaking with you and you'll need to know your stuff on our product (which we’ll provide full training on of course!)§It’s the first of its kind on the market, so all we ask is to bring with you an fiery energy, a passion to learn and an exceptional attitude.  You’ll need:§At least 2 years’ experience in a Team Leader or Management role§Previous experience in a varied customer support role (example roles include Service Desk, Online Customer Services and first line IT Support).§An understanding of Cloud based telecommunications and the marketplace is desirable§The ability to assist customers in the configuration of our product and troubleshoot issues (full training on our product will be given)§Logical and methodical problem-solving skills§Natural ability to lead and develop a team in forward thinking ways, providing 1:1 coaching, training, call listening and auditing for continuous improvement§Ability to work well under pressure and multitask - taking the lead on a variety of tasks and roles§Ability to convey technical issues and processes simply to both the team and customers (at all types of seniority)§Be a great communicator, with an enthusiastic, engaging telephone manner§As well as friendly and outgoing, enjoying being part of a dynamic and close-knit team§A proactive nature, using initiative to self learn and problem solve, staying up to date with the latest industry trends§Excited about the prospect of rolling your sleeves up and getting stuck in!§BENEFITS§In exchange for your talent and commitment, we offer lots of benefits to keep you whistling while you work:§Competitive starting salary with opportunities to increase this quickly§Flexi-time§25 days holiday per year§Never work on your birthday§NZ Superannuation§Private Healthcare (after qualifying period)§Bonus scheme§Chilled dress code§Close-knit team§Free refreshments§Regular social events§This is a fantastic opportunity to join a very fast growing company and will report into our CircleLoop Operations Manager.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§§§
