We’re not your average car finance company; we’re specialists in getting our clients into the car they need and making sure they stay in it. The way we do it? It’s more than our flexible finance - it’s our wraparound support packages that look after our clients, their finances, and their cars.§ §We’re always on the lookout for great talent and none more so than right now.   Delivering the extra special care that we are renowned for is more important than ever, as we help our clients navigate their loans post COVID-19.§ §This is an opportunity to work alongside some of the best minds in the business who have been recognised at industry level for excellence and you will work in a fun and friendly open-plan office in the heart of vibrant Newmarket.§ § § §Who we need:§ §We are looking for Intelligent, customer-focused individuals to join our Customer Care team.§ §To succeed in this role you need to be 100% customer-focused and solutions-driven.  You’ll be keen to grow and progress in an ethical business that cares about people and celebrates success. jobText: TXT/50564202.txt	§Bay Audiology Client Care Coordinator - Hawera§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Bay Audiology Client Care Coordinator - Hawera§§Advertiser: §Amplifon New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §Rest of Taranaki§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Who are we?§  §At Bay Audiology, the heart of our mission is to help people rediscover the joy of hearing.  With over 100 clinics located throughout New Zealand we have grown to become the country's largest Audiology provider.  We offer a range of services from diagnosing hearing difficulties, to fitting, servicing and maintaining hearing aids, and offering ongoing support and care for our customers.   We aim to provide an excellent experience, and that’s where you come in...§  §About the role:§  §As our Client Care Coordinator you will be the smiling face at our Hawera Clinic providing an exceptional service to our locals in the area, making a real difference in the lives of those with hearing loss.  This is a varied role working closely with our Clinician, and no two days will be the same. You will be responsible for the scheduling of appointments,  sales and customer service including basic hearing aid repairs and onsite hearing screening - full training is provided.§  §This is a fixed term contract position working 8.30am - 5.00pm, Tues/Wed/Friday until 31st March 2021 §  §What we are looking for:§ § §Genuine passion and experience in providing excellent customer service§ §Strong attention to detail§ §Sound computer skills as we are a paperless clinic§ §Great self-management and initiative and able to work alone at times§ §Well-developed problem solving skills§ §Previous customer service/administration background§ §A positive, friendly personality§ §What we offer:§  §We are part of the Amplifon Group - the global leader in hearing services and are at the forefront of innovative hearing care services.  We offer solid training, a competitive salary, and a warm, supportive leadership team.  Though this is a contract role, there is potential for this role to go permanent.  Explore your future with us!§  §Apply online with your CV and covering letter today.§Applications close 30th September 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

Our commitment is to provide a way of working with those we support, stakeholders, business partners and staff based on our values - respect, support and excellence.§          §About the role§          §As the Workforce Planner for our newly created Service Centre in Albany, you are the first point of contact for all workforce management needs. The Workforce Planner is responsible for supporting, monitoring, analysing, and enhancing the operations of the Service Centre. You will ensure that Service Level Agreement metrics and KPIs are met and exceeded as we seek to delight our customers while meeting and exceeding the requirements of funders and other stakeholders. Reporting to the Workforce Manager, this position serves as the central point of contact for Team Leaders, Seniors, and Facilitators.§          §Role has regular office hours Monday to Friday.§          §What you'll be doing:§          §            §Provide real-time status anomalies to the business§            §Track, report, and call out real-time adherence issues§            §Process shift trades, schedule change requests, and time off request after schedules are released§            §Review and respond to schedule inquiries from the leadership team and facilitators§            §Run daily buzz meetings that discuss the previous days performance and looks ahead for the current day§            §Run weekend planning meetings. Our commitment is to provide a way of working with those we support, stakeholders, business partners and staff based on our values - respect, support and excellence.§About the role§As the Workforce Planner for our newly created Service Centre in Albany, you are the first point of contact for all workforce management needs. The Workforce Planner is responsible for supporting, monitoring, analysing, and enhancing the operations of the Service Centre. You will ensure that Service Level Agreement metrics and KPIs are met and exceeded as we seek to delight our customers while meeting and exceeding the requirements of funders and other stakeholders. Reporting to the Workforce Manager, this position serves as the central point of contact for Team Leaders, Seniors, and Facilitators.§Role has regular office hours Monday to Friday.§What you'll be doing:§Provide real-time status anomalies to the business§Track, report, and call out real-time adherence issues§Process shift trades, schedule change requests, and time off request after schedules are released§Review and respond to schedule inquiries from the leadership team and facilitators§Run daily buzz meetings that discuss the previous days performance and looks ahead for the current day§Run weekend planning meetings. Look at unassigned cares and looking at resourcing requirements§What you'll bring to the position§We are looking for someone who has a strong analytical mind with proven workforce management/planning or real time analysis experience. You will have the ability to think outside the box and offer effective solutions that take into account all the full picture.§You will also have the following:§Strong knowledge about Workforce Management Contact Centre disciplines§An ability to effectively manage and prioritise your workload, including multiple requests§A strong and sound decision-making ability§Proven MS Excel skills and familiarity working with Workforce Management systems§Why us:§The opportunity to work with one of New Zealand's preferred employers§Thorough supported orientation§Ongoing training with professional development opportunities§A friendly and supportive workplace§If you are passionate about providing support to a wide range of people and think you would like a career with Healthcare NZ, then we would want to hear from you!§Mēnā he tangata ngākaunui ana koe ki te tautoko i ngā momo tāngata, tēnā pea, kei konei he tūranga mōu. Tukua mai tō tono ki Healthcare NZ.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Our reputation for high quality innovative machinery and impeccable after market service drives our passion within this primary sector.§ § § §About the role§ §An opportunity to join the team in Palmerston North within our Customer Services has become available. Due to the investment growth we are seeking a high calibre customer services manager with proven sales order entry, call centre experience, customer fulfilment operational skills and customer sales information services within the agriculture sector and preferably knowledge of the machinery sector.§ § § §Key responsibilities include§ §•Promoting the products and services to our existing and new customer base.§ §•Call centre activities and managing all enquiries from phone, email, and website.§ §•Practical knowledge of our Agri range machinery.§ §•CRM interfaces within our ERP system Epicor.§ §•Order entry for whole goods and spare parts orders from NZ, AU & UK.§ §•Meeting annual and monthly KPI targets.§ §•Achieving the annual sales plans and supporting our field base sales executive.§ §About you§ §To be successful in this role, you will likely have:§ §•Proven track record within the agriculture, machinery or manufacturing sectors or similar.§ §•Excellence in interpersonal and communication skills , phone and PC dexterity.§ §•An understanding of client relationship management and over the phone customer experience in solving and managing customer queries.§ §•Attention to detail and effective computer literacy – MS Office, Epicor / SAP or similar ERP software.§ §•Tertiary qualified at degree level marketing, digital, or business-related professional qualifications.§ §Sounds like your kind of role?§ §If being encouraged to pursue excellence every day inspires you, you'll fit right in here. Not only do we strive to be the best in New Zealand's market, we're also a global brand with ongoing projects to keep us moving onwards and upwards. For someone with your motivation to succeed, it doesn't get any better than this. An attractive remuneration- performance based and the opportunity to develop within an exciting phase in the company's strategy direction are on offer.§With our ongoing commitment towards health and safety, you'll undergo a pre-employment drug test that will form part of your application and you should be aligned to our values of Passion for people, Entrepreneurial spirit, Agile productivity, Courage to reach new horizons and Best in class workplace practices.§Applications close on Friday, 30th September 2020.§ §Please send your details, resume to §alistair@reese.co.nz§ or contact for an informal discussion on §021431002§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a customer services manager?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50580818.txt	§Customer Services and Sales Consultant - Full time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Services and Sales Consultant - Full time§§Advertiser: §National Mini Storage§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Are you looking for a role with variety and responsibility? Are you looking for a company where you can grow and develop?  §  §We currently have an opportunity in our Penrose Branch for a full time customer services consultant.  You will be rostered for 5 days a week (Tuesday to Saturday).  The hours during the week are 9am-5pm and 8am-4pm on a Saturday.   §  §On a day to day basis, you will use your great customer, organisational and communication skills to answer customer enquiries, sign up new customers that walk into the branch or over the phone, manage invoices and payments, and keeping the facility tidy and clean. Some days will be busy, and some quiet however there are always things to do.§  §You will be:§ § §Great with customers and selling solutions in person and over the phone§ §Able to adapt to different environments and operate effectively where you don't have all the details§ §Great communicator understanding the importance of sharing info with your team§ §Confident with the use of computers using Outlook and Word§ §Happy to manage your day to day work schedule§ §Great with detail and focused on getting things right§ §Able to deal with change, as well as being able to work well with a variety of different people.§ §A good team player who will get stuck in where needed and use their initiative to get jobs done. § §If you like the sound of the role apply now to join a company who will give you the right support and development to succeed and to progress within the company.  You will be part of a fun caring team environment, where people are acknowledged for their contribution and of course receive a remuneration package that will recognise your skills and performance.§  §To apply please click the apply button below.  §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

jobText: TXT/50621451.txt	§Monitoring Operator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Monitoring Operator§§Advertiser: §Electra Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§ §Energetic, forward-thinking and dynamic team environment§ §Keep your days free and work on our night-shift§ §Starting rate of $20.74 / hour with room to grow your skills!§ §Securely™ is a Levin-based company that provides medical alarms, house alarms and business alarms. We offer a 24/7 alarm monitoring service for our wide range of customers throughout New Zealand with offices in Levin, Tauranga, and Lower Hutt.  Securely™ embraces cutting-edge international technology to deliver alarm solutions over and above what is expected and with an enviable product range, we’re experiencing fantastic growth.  The future looks bright.§ §About the role§ §As our newest team member, you’ll be responsible for supporting different customer enquiries in an outbound and inbound capacity.  You will be providing customers with information, updates and managing their queries and complaints, promptly. The types of calls you may receive range from commercial and domestic security alarm queries through to medical alarm activations and electricity outage/fault enquiries. This is a very diverse, fast-paced and demanding role that will see you busy from the start to the end of your day!§ §About you§ §Experience in a customer service role, is a must. ideally in a call-centre environment. You must have a mature mindset, are considered and empathetic when approaching your customers.   § §You must be adaptable and open to change, excited at the possibility of learning new things, and have a great attitude!  You'll also be computer literate and have a good handle on using different systems, including Microsoft Office.§ §About the team§ §You will be working with a close-knit, driven and motivated group of individuals that help one another, no matter how busy they get. With a Senior Monitoring Operator on each shift, you’ll be able to ask questions and approach situations confidently.  We provide great training too!§ §This role is on a night-shift, and the hours are:§ §Shift A § §Saturday – 12am – 8am§ §Sunday – 12am – 8am§ §Monday – 4pm – midnight§ §Why join Securely™?  § §We offer a great solution to having your days free, working on our night and afternoon shift patterns,  a competitive hourly rate, great training and excellent company benefits. § §If successful, you will be required to undergo pre-employment drug and alcohol testing and other pre-employment checks.  We’ll expect you to know all about us, so visit https://securely.nz  to find out more!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50580336.txt	§Retail Assistant - Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Retail Assistant - Auckland§§Advertiser: §Fonterra Co-operative Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§ §Do you have a passion for food, dairy and cheese & love customer interaction?§ §Utilise your strong hospitality or retail experience in this varied role!§ §Enjoy the flexibility of a part-time role that fits around your lifestyle§ §Your Purpose§  §Our Fonterra Headquarters is looking for a passionate and engaging person to be the friendly face of our in-house Fonterra store.  Make this role your own and express your creative and innovative ideas! §  §As our in-House Retail Assistant, you will be engaging with our internal staff members as well customers from the surrounding area. From talking to people on our products, merchandising, and driving sales, you’ll never be bored in this role! §  §15 - 20 Hours a week, Monday, Wednesday & Thursday, 1-5pm (potential to be adjusted) §  §About you §  §To be successful in this role you will be a self-motivated, professional with good communication skills and the ability to build a rapport with a diverse range of people. You will preferably have a background in customer service within either hospitality or retail. §  §Other responsibilities include: § § §Developing the store§ §Driving sales and initiatives§ §Inventory and stock control§ §Store administration§ §Working with others in the business§ §Our Story§  §Fonterra Farm Source is the face and place of Fonterra in the community, and our hubs combine the benefits of a rural retail store and community facility. We also have awesome training and development opportunities and provide a web of natural career progression opportunities across both Farm Source and the wider Fonterra business. If you use your initiative, have a great attitude, and live our values, the sky is the limit. §  §This is an exciting opportunity for you to make a real impact with our community as our newest Retail Assistant. Take your career forward – apply today!§  § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50598529.txt	§Customer Service Industrial Engineering Supplies§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Industrial Engineering Supplies§§Advertiser: §ASL Industries Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Do you have an Industrial Engineering or Welding background? This could be the ideal job for you.§ §ASL Industries is one of New Zealand's leading Saw Service and Supply companies,doing business from its Silverdale location for more than 25years.§ §After becoming the local BOC Gas Exchange Agent, ASL has expanded its product offering to include Welders and a comprehensive range of Welding consumables, Cut off Discs, Flap wheels, Grinding Discs, Abrasives, Lubricants, hydraulic oils, transmission fluids and grease, Arlube products and Health & Safety supplies to name a few.§ §This role carry's the responsibility for sales of our products to walk-in trade customers, as well as by phone, email, Social media and website driven enquiries.§ § §Ensure high levels of customer service are maintained.§ §Increase sales by building strong relationships with customers.§ §Produce documentation for incoming work for the Saw service Centre and Counter sales. Order Entry, Cash / Handling, Eftpos§ §Assist in maintaining shop stock levels.§ §Complete documentation accurately, meet deadlines§ §Pricing and Quotations.§ §Inwards and Outwards goods.§ §Forklift License would be an advantage.§ §Serve BOC Gas exchange customers.§ §You will§ §Have good communication skills.§ §Enjoy building relationships with customers and team mates.§ §Have a hard working attitude with the ability to work under pressure.§ §A sound knowledge of our products, or a keen interest to learn.§ §Enjoy working locally.§ §Previous experience in a similar role or with a similar industry's would be an advantage.§ §We offer a highly competitive remuneration package.§ §Heavy Lifting is required.§ §Hours Mon – Thursday 8.00am – 5.00pm Fri 8.00am - 4.00pm.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following forklift licences do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What is the maximum weight that you are comfortable and able to lift?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

If you enjoy interacting with people and have a passion for turning prospects into well-satisfied customers, then we want to hear from you! § This is a great opportunity for people interested in getting into sales and a foot in the door of a well-known New Zealand Insurance Company. We are looking for strong communicators who will thrive in a fast-paced call centre environment. § Contact centre or phone-based sales experience is valuable, however experience in a contact centre is not essential; all you need is a can-do attitude along with a strong sales drive! If you consider yourself customer-centric with a knack for selling, then we have positions available for you. § What we are offering you:   §Full time Monday - Friday position§Central Wellington CBD location§Great career opportunities§Welcoming team-based environment §Medical Insurance§ What you can expect in the role: §Ongoing support and training§Challenging and rewarding conversations with customers§The opportunity to gain transferrable skills§Structured work environment§ Hours: §    §Work 37.5 hours per week; 12.30pm– 8.30pm Monday – Thursday and 11.30am - 7.30pm Friday§ Please note: training will be 2 weeks of full time hours between the hours of 10am-6pm Monday to Friday §About you: § §While a sales background is preferred, it is not essential. All you need to succeed is:§The ability to act with customers in mind§Be a great conversationalist§Learn and adapt quickly to a manner of different situations§Resilient in the face of setbacks§Have a target driven mindset§ Interviews and a role play will be held with Cigna from the 28th September until the 9th October. Candidates must be available for a start date of 26th October.   § These opportunities will not last long! Apply today by following the prompts.§§§§

jobTitle: Client Services Specialist Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50591376.txt	§Client Services Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Client Services Specialist§§Advertiser: §Kin§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§A bit about us... §CRS Software Ltd is the leading provider of farm management software in New Zealand. We are a 100% kiwi owned agribusiness company with over 30 years’ experience in the development of software for the rural sector. With more than 10,000 farmers and businesses throughout New Zealand and Australia using our software, our role is to help them to measure and manage their business performance and make better decisions for their future. §   § The recent release of our next generation solution Cash Manager Focus almost completes our evolution to a fully cloud based SaaS business. But there is still plenty to do and we would love you to come and join us on the journey! §   § We aim to keep our customers at the heart of everything we do and are looking for a Client Services Specialist to join us on our mission. If that’s you, read on! § §The role §Based in our Masterton office, the Client Services Specialist is a pivotal part of our business and provides exceptional service to our customers. Every day, you will be building strong relationships with our customers and assisting them with queries in a timely way. You will also be the one to share information with customers about new products and services that may help them with their farming or agricultural business.  Day to day this role will: § § §Engage with customers over the phone, email and chat to resolve issues and problem solve § §Escalate issues when appropriate to the CST Manager § §Share customer feedback with the CST Manager to assist with product or process improvements § §Look for ways to add value to customers by suggesting additional products  § §Keep up to date with our product, including any new features or upcoming releases § §Share knowledge with the wider Client Services Team and contribute to our collaborative culture § § §About you § You will be a natural when it comes to engaging with a variety of people and have a customer-centric approach to your work. Ideally, you will come from a farming or accounting background and be able to connect with our customers quickly. You will be a self-starter who is motivated and passionate towards providing exceptional customer service. §  §You will also have: § § §Proven experience in a service centre environment § §Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal § §An ability to pick up new technologies and technical concepts quickly § §An analytical approach towards problem solving § §A highly organised and proactive approach to your work § §A drive towards promoting our product in a positive way § §A background in farming or agriculture would be an advantage. § § Our CST are a busy team and will need someone who can hit the ground running.  In return we offer a supportive and flexible environment where you will have room to learn and grow. § §If you think you have what it takes, then what are you waiting for?  We have partnered with Kin to fill this exciting role. If you are ready to go, apply now with your CV and cover letter telling us why you’d be a great addition to the team. Or, if you have some questions, please contact Tracey Fletcher on tracey.fletcher@kin.co.nz.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50624579.txt	§Outbound Sales Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Outbound Sales Representative§§Advertiser: §Coca-Cola Amatil NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Sales - Outbound§§§§§§The Pitch.§The Coca-Cola Amatil NZ Contact Centre has the best Outbound B2B Sales team in the industry and we have a bunch of industry awards to prove it! We've got passionate teams focused on providing a world-class customer experience and a team culture that will make you fizz. To top it off we have the best known brands in the world to sell to some of the best customers in the country. Due to an internal promotion, we are on the hunt for an Outbound Sales Representative to join our awesome team, so if you're looking for an exciting new career, apply now!§The Role.§The key to this role is going to be your ability to influence the sale using your exceptionally savvy sales skills to match our products to customer requirements over the phone. You must have the drive and passion to achieve your results focused KPI's. You'll be proficient in planning and time management as well as being part of our continuous improvement mind set.§What Do I Need?§Drive, Resilience, and Exceptional People Skills! To be part of the Outbound Sales team you will need great communication skills, be an expert at building relationships and have a strong Customer Experience focus. Experience in the sales capacity is a must and you’ll have a proven track record of delivering results. We want you to demonstrate your ability to hit sales targets and thrive on monthly initiatives.§The Benefits.§You'll get a competitive salary, plenty of complimentary product, superannuation, company shares, product gifting, life and income protection insurance, as well as free parking onsite in a convenient Mt Wellington location!  It doesn't get much better than that!  Most importantly, with our world-famous learning and development environment it is your future that will be invested in - who knows where your Amatil NZ career path will take you!§The Culture.§We are exceptionally proud to be recognised as one of NZ’s Best Employers four years in a row! If you ask our team what they love about working here, they'll tell you it's our people, our brands, and our culture. Our vision and values are at the heart of everything we do, and we are committed to creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities for our employees. Bring the real you and be part of a culture where we embrace equal opportunities and promote diversity and inclusion. We encourage you to apply to bring your unique differences and perspectives to Coca Cola Amatil.§Applications Close: 7 October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50598596.txt	§Roadside Assistance Call Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Roadside Assistance Call Centre§§Advertiser: §Apollo Motorhome Holidays§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§About the role§ §  §Apollo guests travel from all corners of the globe to visit Australia and New Zealand and travel in an Apollo campervan or Motorhome. If any guest requires assistance while on the road, our team provides the support they need to continue enjoying their holiday. In this role you would be providing our traveling guests with solutions over the phone ranging from quick & easy trouble-shooting to more complex logistical solutions in order to get vehicles repaired and guests back on the road.§  §Key objective: §To provide an outstanding guest experience by providing fast, friendly and timely service thereby minimising any impact or downtime to our guest’s holiday.§  §To achieve this, your key activities will include: § § §Assist guests and other departments with vehicle related problems.§ §Negotiate best possible outcomes for guest experience while balancing business requirements.§ §Track incidents to ensure guests are kept well informed of solutions and repair progress.§ §Minimise vehicle repair time.§ §Ensure repairs are being carried out in accordance with standard repair practices.§ §This position is based at our Auckland Rental Centre, and is a permanent full time role with approximately 40 hours per week plus some reasonable additional hours on a ten day per fortnight roster. Shifts are between 8am and 7pm. This position requires some weekend shifts as per roster. §  §Skills and Experiences§  §We are looking for a well-organised and team-focused individual with high energy levels and a passion for helping external and internal customers.§  §You should possess the following skills and experiences to be successful in this role:§ § §Guest services and call center experience,§ §Excellent interpersonal skills and an empathetic communication style,§ §Strong problem solving abilities,§ §An automotive understanding or mechanical aptitude would benefit but is not essential§ §Good time management and the ability to prioritise tasks and remain calm under pressure,§ §Comfortable with following processes and procedures,§ §Intermediate computer skills.§ §A second language such as, German or any other European language would be beneficial.§  §Culture and Benefits§  §We offer a supportive team environment and unique industry benefits such as paid camping leave in addition to annual leave. You will also be able to take advantage of our generous staff rental policy which allows you to use RVs free of charge.§  §If you are looking for a fast-paced, yet rewarding role in an exciting industry, and you believe you possess the required skills and experiences, then please apply now.§  §About the company§  §Apollo Motorhome Holidays is a division of Apollo Tourism & Leisure Ltd (ATL).  ATL is listed on the Australian Stock Exchange and is a multi-national, vertically integrated manufacturer, rental fleet operator, wholesaler and retailer of a broad range of recreational vehicles, including motorhomes, campervans and caravans.§  §With locations in Australia, New Zealand, the USA and Canada, UK/Ireland and Europe opportunities to join our team at any level are endless. Explore a new career in anything from customer service to management, either at our branches or within our Head Office in Brisbane.§  §Your future at Apollo is limited only by your imagination. Our dedication to staff development is a reality, not just a slogan.§  §With every role making real contributions to the business, you have the unique opportunity to make history as part of the Apollo success story.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you available to work on a rotating roster?§What's your expected hourly rate?§§§

You will be calling on behalf of the digital marketing agency to sell advertising spots on their website and to promote their local targeted marketing services. § §The Hours:§ Monday – Friday 11am -7pm (Flexibility required)§ §Training:§ 1 hour intensive training session – looking for confident, experience sales agents who will be able to hit the ground running.§ §What about you?§ You describe yourself as a go-getter, you see the glass as half full, and have previous experience in a call centre environment handling a high volume of calls. You are resilient and you brush the no’s off your shoulder and keep going. You will be presenting solutions and closing sales, so it is essential that you have outstanding communication skills as well as a ‘hunter’ mentality. § §Must Haves:§ §• 2+ years’ experience in outbound sales §• Cold calling experience§• High level of initiative and enthusiasm §• Well-developed negotiation skills §• Outgoing and positive personality§• Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills §• Confident in objection handling with the ability to think on your feet §• Resilience – the ability to bounce back and remain objective after a difficult call§ §What’s in it for you? The benefits:§• Competitive rates, including commission§• Vibrant and energetic team culture §• Further potential campaign opportunities available§ §If you feel that a role which will challenge you every day, has a fast-paced working environment and a great team of people is for you, then we want to hear from you! Click apply today!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50550135.txt	§Customer Service§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service§§Advertiser: §Wilderness Motorhomes / SmartRV§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§§Who we are§Here at SmartRV, we are passionate about matching our customers with their very own dream motorhome and supporting them throughout their ownership journey. To achieve this we sell premium products and back this up by providing superior support and service. If you want to find out more about what we do, go to www.smartrv.co.nz §Who you are§To join our team and be successful in this role you will be looking to build and diversify your strong customer service skills, be solution focussed, and a pro at problem-solving. You will have a calm and pragmatic approach that allows you to successfully juggle multiple demands at one time whilst being effective and efficient at getting through your task list. Your verbal and written communication skills will be second to none and you will confidently be able to pick up new systems and processes quickly.§What you’ll be doing§Variety is at the core of this role with each day being different. You will perform a variety of tasks such as handing over the keys of your customers brand new motorhome, answering calls and emails as well as provide face to face service with our valued clientele.  The support you provide throughout each owner’s journey will be something you take great pride in and full ownership of.  This is a unique opportunity for someone who is up for a new challenge and is only genuinely satisfied once the customer is. §This is a great opportunity to develop your customer service career in a passionate and dedicated team, so don’t hesitate to apply today!§How to Apply§If you think this sounds like your dream opportunity, we'd love to hear from you so please apply now by sumitting your CV and cover letter and then follow up by leaving a voicemail message with all of your details on our dedicated recruitment number §09 281 3619§, which is listed at the bottom of our application form.§Application Process & Updates§Part of the application process includes completing a job specific application form and calling and leaving a voicemail message to tell us why you think you have what it takes. Depending on the job board and device you apply with, you'll either see the form on the next screen or it will be emailed to you immediately, upon receiving your application. §Please check your inbox (and junk mail) for application updates. Emails are sent via our recruitment software, Chilli Factor. §§§§§

The role's focus is being part of and supporting our Auckland based team while being situated in our Christchurch office.  Reporting to the Customer Service Manager, your proven customer service and organisational skills will be critical in providing exceptional service to our customers nationwide.  This role is full-time, working Monday-Friday 8:30am-5:00pm. We are looking for a team player who likes to be in a busy environment and has a sense of pride when helping others.§ §Location:§ Sydenham Christchurch§ §Your responsibilities:§ § §Participate in achievement of the sales budget by processing customer orders received by telephone, email, Webshop, CRM and over the counter.§ §Follow up on customer enquiries pertaining to product, deliveries, or supply shortages.§ §Handling of customer queries relating to company product or service.§ §Processing of return authorities through to credit note onto customer accounts.§ §Outbound calls to existing customer to promote special updates/offers.§ §Creation of new customer accounts and amendments.§ §Provide support to field sales team and other departments § §To be successful for this role, you will have:§ § §experience in customer service within a healthcare industry, preferably dental;§ §exceptional attention to detail; as well as accurate data entry;§ §the ability to prioritise and manage time;§ §excellent communication skills, both written and verbal;§ §ability to multi task in a fast paced, open office environment;§ §a resourceful and resilient approach to problem solving;§ §previous experience in SAP CRM system or similar software§ §Join us on our journey to shape the future of dentistry§ §Ivoclar Vivadent is one of the world's leading dental companies with approximately 3500 employees globally. We love innovation and we thrive on it. We are known for our long-standing experience and high quality. We are guided by our strong values and the company culture of a sustainably operated family-owned business with a long-term vision.§ §Our mission is making people smile§ §In order to achieve this goal, we are looking for people with good ideas, courage and exceptional drive: focused minds who share our passion. We offer a multifaceted work environment which is characterized by mutual respect and close collaboration. We translate words into action and continue to evolve. We challenge traditional ways and methods of doing business, and we have grown exponentially over the last ten years. Our customers, and their experience with us, come first so we make it a top priority to have one of the best customer service teams around.§  §To enable us to continue delivering excellence, we are on the lookout for standout, top-notch Customer Services Team Members to join us. Vacancies currently exist with both Amtech and Newtech, based here in Whanganui.§  §Our team is a fast-paced environment but we aim to have fun and work well together. We believe that it truly takes teamwork to achieve our goals and provide service we can be proud of. You’ll be surrounded by and working with an inspiring bunch of folks dedicated to service excellence.§  §In this dynamic role you will: §  §•          Communicate clearly with all our customers in a calm and professional manner§  §•          Provide information and support regarding our products and services§  §•          Develop and maintain productive working relationships with customers and fellow staff alike§  §Some of the key things you'll possess to successfully perform this role include: §  §•          The availability to work §Monday to Friday 8:30am – 5:30pm §  §•          Proven experience in customer service or retail to deal with a diverse range of customer queries§  §•          A willingness to learn and take on board our policies and procedures§  §•          Comfort using new systems and processes §  §•          Strong communication skills to engage our customers, discuss products and services that they need and provide solutions.§  §This role will suit you if you're looking for an opportunity to grow your skills and challenge yourself. jobText: TXT/50549809.txt	§Face-to-Face Fundraisers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Face-to-Face Fundraisers§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Red Cross§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Face-to-Face Fundraiser §§ §§Be part of the largest humanitarian network in the world! § §Help establish New Zealand Red Cross’ first in-house face-to-face fundraising team and make a difference.§ §Competitive hourly rate, paid training and opportunities to grow within New Zealand Red Cross.§§ §§New Zealand Red Cross is extremely excited to be announcing the launch of §its first ever in-house face-to-face fundraising team§.§ We are looking for a select number of friendly, outgoing and confident individuals to help build and grow this initiative. §§As an In-House Face-to-Face Fundraiser, you will play an integral role in building the culture and dynamic of the team. By inspiring members of the public to become a New Zealand Red Cross supporter, you’ll be making a massive difference to the lives of millions of people. This role will provide you with the opportunity to use your passion for making a difference, not only here in New Zealand, but all over the world, whilst building your career in the sales, marketing and the charity sector.§Key responsibilities:§§Inspire members of the public to become regular monthly donors and encourage people to be part of this global humanitarian movement.§ §Represent New Zealand Red Cross in a positive and inspiring manner.§ §Build rapport with people and provide an excellent donor experience.§ §Support new and existing team members.§ §Actively participate in relevant New Zealand Red Cross team building, meetings, training or group activities.§ §Assist with other duties as assigned by the In-House Face-to-Face Fundraising Team Leader or Manager.§ §Adhere to the New Zealand Red Cross policies and Public Fundraising regulations.§ §Ensure accurate processing and administration of donor sign-ups.§The position is based in Wellington with an expectation to travel within the region. This is an exciting opportunity to stamp your mark and contribute to the overall establishment of New Zealand Red Cross’ first in-house face-to-face fundraising programme. Along with this, you will be improving your communication and marketing skills, as well as obtaining many transferable skills for your future career.§What’s in it for you? §§Competitive hourly rate and incentives§ §Social, fun and supportive team environment§ §Paid, full comprehensive training on fundraising skills and charity knowledge§ §Charity uniform and tablet to use while working§ §Being an integral part of the foundation of the team§ §Opportunity for career progression and growth§ §Leadership opportunities and training§§To be considered for this role, you must be:§§Confident, social and passionate about the cause§ §Energetic, with a can-do positive attitude§ §Reliable, trustworthy and hardworking§ §Fluent in English, with strong communication skills§ §A supportive team player§ §Motivated, with the willingness to learn§ §Driven to meet targets§ §Committed to a minimum of three months’ full-time work§ §Experience in a public facing role is preferred§ §A New Zealand citizen or permanent resident or hold a valid working visa§ §Immediate start is available.§To apply for the position, please apply at §https://mclaren.co.nz/vacancies/§Applications to: §Ngan Nguyen via mclaren.co.nz§Position description: §Available to view at mclaren.co.nz§ §§Applications will be reviewed and actioned as received.§§ §P: §04 499 1069§W: §mclaren.co.nz§E: §admin@mclaren.co.nz§§ §§§§§

That's why we're looking for a new hands-on Customer Satisfaction Team Leader to join our wellington based crew and lead our growing CS team.§Adulttoymegastore.co.nz has become the biggest online retailer for adult toys in New Zealand, and now we deliver to Australia, USA, Canada and the UK too. We have grown in leaps and bounds, and it’s all because we have a great team, and hire great people. We're local, owned and operated here in Wellington - come join us!§What we'll need from you§- Proven experience as a customer service team leader or manager§  §- Great communication skills and dedication to good service which will mean our customers love shopping at ATMS - even when things don’t go quite to plan, you and your team will make sure everything gets put right.§- You'll be a multi-tasker like no other, assisting your team to facilitate emails, instant chats and phone queries, all while working on projects that enhance customer service within the business§  §- You’ll have great relationship management skills that will assist you in getting the best from our third party delivery partners§  §- You'll be a great ambassador for our brand – you'll be the face, voice and values of our company to our customers.§- Your mature and positive attitude to sex, sexuality will guide your team and will mean our customers always feel comfortable getting in touch.§  §- While this is a largely online role, you'll be just as confident with face-to-face customer service when we take ATMS on the road to expos and events.§What you'll get in return§- A supportive working environment where your development will be a priority. Our people are important to us, so there's always lots of opportunities to try different tasks and learn new skills.§- Good work-life balance. We work (very!) hard, but we play hard too. We have a high-performance culture so we like to have fun and celebrate our wins along the way.§- A really decent coffee machine so you and your team can whizz through those customer emails at an impressive caffeine-induced pace§- Some pretty great work stories. Yep, the adult toy world can definitely be eye-opening but we have a very open-minded, fun-loving approach to our little industry and no two days are ever the same!§  § §  §To apply please §  §1. Upload a tailor-made covering letter outlining exactly why your think you have what it takes to join and lead our ATMS CSR team§  §2. Upload your CV outlining your CSR and team leader experience§  § §  §** Please note we are currently advertising for  both a Customer Service Superstar and a Customer Service Team Leader role. Please only apply for the one you think suits you best. Thanks§  § §  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§§§

jobText: TXT/50550176.txt	§Wharf Host - Waiheke - Fixed term part time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Wharf Host - Waiheke - Fixed term part time§§Advertiser: §Fullers Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Wharf Host - Waiheke - Fixed term part time §      §        §About us§        §Sometimes we feel the need to pinch ourselves. Because that’s us, out there. On the Gulf. And getting paid for it. Fullers360 was born of a love for the Hauraki Gulf in 1981. And 35 years downwind, our network unifies the entire Gulf. Through a reliable network and the passion of 350 crew and staff, Fullers360 ferries nearly 6 million people every year, getting commuters to work and visitors to play. We’re in an exciting phase of growing our tourism market, restless to elevate the experience we deliver to every single one of our customers. §        § §        §Our Purpose §        §Unifying the Hauraki Gulf by bringing together friends and whanau, supporting communities and businesses, opening up treasured destinations and sharing our local taonga.§        § §        §About the role§        §Do you take everything in your stride and with a smile on your face? Are you confident commanding a crowd? Able to negotiate and persuade others with ease?§        §You’ll be confident, outgoing and not afraid of commanding a crowd.§        §This is not your average summer job, and you won’t be stuck in an office! Instead you’ll be on the wharf in the heart of the action validating tickets and directing & assisting customers with whatever their needs are, ensuring they are in the right place and boarding the correct service. You’ll also be keeping them updated when services reach capacity and advising of the next service time, along with any other general enquires.§        §We are currently looking for an energetic team player to join our team on a fixed term part time basis - from October until approx February 2021§        §This is a role full of customer interaction where you will be responsible for providing information and general assistance to our customers. §        § §        §What we are looking for:§        §You will need to be a people person with great customer service and excellent communication skills as you will be assisting customers to face to face and helping them plan their experience with us.§        § §        §          §Someone who is outgoing, reliable and has a positive attitude!§          §Excellent communication skills.§          §Previous experience in customer service desired, but not essential§          §Ability to build and sustain relationships with our customers.§          §Promotes a positive team atmosphere.§        §        § §        §Our Company Values §        §Welcoming§ - There’s nothing we love more than being able to call the Hauraki Gulf home. But sharing it with others comes pretty close.§        §Restless§ - We’re hungry for innovation and excellence and always on the look-out for The Better Way.§        §Safe & Shipshape §- Our operations run like clockwork, so we can look after those on board.§        §Straight up§ - We say what we mean, and we do what we say.§        §Owning it §- We’re an efficient team and rely on each other. And people rely on us for a seamless experience. Let’s not let them down.§        § §        §Benefits:§        §Fullers offer many benefits including:§        §          §Discounted gym membership;§          §Discounted healthcare;§          §Leisure travel§        §        § §        §Hours:§        §As Fullers operates 7 days a week, this position is on a roster basis and will include weekend shifts and public holidays.§        § §        §Candidates must have the legal right to work in New Zealand.§        § §        §Please note: Any information you provide will be used to evaluate your suitability to this position. We will hold onto your details for any future opportunities unless asked otherwise.§      §      §      §    §  §§§About us§  §Sometimes we feel the need to pinch ourselves. jobText: TXT/50681399.txt	§Customer Services Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Services Representative§§Advertiser: §Environmental Protection Authority (EPA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Make history with us§ §As New Zealand’s environmental regulator, the work we do today helps shape the future of Aotearoa.§ §Our Finance and Systems Group is responsible for the development, management and implementations of programmes and innovations to increase the EPA’s effectiveness and performance.§ §We are increasing our current capability by appointing an in house customer services representative (CSR) to be the first point of call for our customers.§ §The opportunity § §We are seeking an experienced customer service representative who’s looking for a role to get stuck in and add value from day one. This role will offer plenty of chances to help us design and improve our systems and processes to make sure we’re delivering the best service to our customers.§ §As one of our brand new CSR’s you’ll get the chance to help us shape what our contact centre will look like going forward. We’d also love you to bring your enthusiasm for continuous improvement – we’ll be looking to you to help us understand why our customers are calling and how we can improve our online tools.§ §The role will include answering calls and emails from our customers on a range of topics we regulate, including Hazardous Substances and the Emissions Trading Scheme. To keep you busy you’ll also provide our Finance and Systems team with administrative support during any quiet periods on the phone.§ §About you§ §We don't expect you to know everything from day one, but we’d love our successful candidate to have:§ § §Experience as a frontline customer service representative§ §Experience in general office and administration§ §Is exceptionally well organised§ §Has  a strong ability to build and maintain effective working relationships§ §Public sector experience§ §A proactive approach with great initiatives§ §All the usual skills it takes to succeed (a good work ethic, attention to detail, a great communicator, familiar with the Microsoft Office applications)§ §Science qualification (advantageous but not essential)§ §This position may also suit you if you are looking to get your foot in the door of an organisation with scientific experts and professionals with this same shared vision; or you may be seasoned in offering exceptional customer service; either way we want to hear from you.§ §What we can offer you§ §This is a permanent full-time position based in our central city offices on Lambton Quay. The role provides plenty of variety, interesting and challenging opportunities, working with colleagues focused on making a difference.§ §Some of the benefits of working with us include on-site weekly Māori language lessons and regular workshops to develop staff understanding and appreciation of Te Ao Māori; talks on a variety of topics from fascinating external speakers; and a range of clubs and groups, from gardening to adventure running, that cater to the diverse interests of our staff.§ §We also offer our staff extra leave on top of the standard legislative requirements.§ §How to apply § §For a copy of the job description please click here. Or contact §julia.holman@epa.govt.nz§ §Check out the careers section of our website for more information at www.epa.govt.nz§ §Applications close 5pm 19 October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50681008.txt	§Bay Audiology Client Care Coordinator - Tauranga§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Bay Audiology Client Care Coordinator - Tauranga§§Advertiser: §Amplifon New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Who are we?§ §At Bay Audiology, the heart of our mission is to help people rediscover the joy of hearing.  With over 120 clinics located throughout New Zealand we have grown to become the country's largest hearing care provider.  We offer a range of services, from diagnosing hearing difficulties, to fitting, servicing and maintaining hearing aids, and offering ongoing support and care for our customers.   We aim to provide an excellent experience, and that’s where you come in...§ §About the role:§ §As our Client Care Coordinator, you will be the smiling face at the front desk of our Bureta Park clinic, making a real difference in the lives of those with hearing loss.  This is a varied role working closely with our clinicians, and no two days will be the same. You will be responsible for the scheduling of appointments, onsite hearing screening, consumable sales, and  basic hearing aid repairs, all the while providing an exceptional customer experience!  § §This is a full time, fixed term contract starting in November until 21st June 2021. §The hours for this role are Monday to Friday 8.30am - 5.00pm§ §What we are looking for:§ § §Previous experience in a customer focused role§ §Genuine passion for providing excellent customer service§ §Strong attention to detail§ §Sound computer skills as we are a paperless clinic§ §Well-developed problem solving skills§ §A positive, friendly personality§ §What we offer:§ §If you are looking for a meaningful, challenging career at the forefront of innovative hearing care services, a competitive salary, staff benefits and a supportive leadership team - explore your future with us!  Full training is provided.§ §Apply online with your CV and covering letter today§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Please indicate if you consent to the company holding your application information on file at the conclusion of this process in relation to any future employment opportunities within the Amplifon Group.§§§

We hope to always deliver: the very best cars; undeniable value and service that we are truly proud of. §  §Ezi Values:§ Welcoming, Genuine, Dynamic, Uncomplicated, Efficient. At Ezi we live our values to help create a more enjoyable journey for our customers, wherever it may take them. §  §To find out more about us, visit  §www.ezicarrental.co.nz.§  §  §The role: §  §We are looking for two Customer Relations Agents for our Auckland Branches to provide outstanding customer service to our customers, so they have great, hassle free and enjoyable travels across our beautiful country. These are full-time positions for 40 hours per week working Monday to Sunday on a rotating roster including weekends and public holidays. §  §Customer Relations Agent (CRA) play a key role in the company. As the first and last point of contact with our customers, a Customer Relations Agents are always required to maintain professionalism and display outstanding communication and customer service skills.  §  §CRA’s are responsible for processing rental transactions, ensuring a smooth and efficient counter process for our customers and will contribute significantly to branch incremental sales performance. As the face of the company, by focusing on the wants and needs of the customer you will have opportunity to positively influence customer satisfaction and retention critical in today's Domestic Tourism market due to covid - 19 restrictions. §  §In addition to the customer service and sales part of the role, there shall be additional responsibilities of administrative tasks like completing checklists and checking and completing reports.§  §Key skills and role requirements: § § § §Full Driver’s license §  § § §Excellent verbal and written communication skills §  § § §High level of computer literacy §  § § §Past experience of counter sales or confident selling our value-add products to benefit our customers §  § § §Experience working within car rental industry is preferable not essential §  § § §Past experience of using Car+ software or adapting well to new software technological systems §  § § §Ability to drive manual and automatic vehicles and all types of vehicles from small cars to cargo vans §  § § §Punctual and hardworking §  § § §Multitasker, attention to detail and team player §  § §Why work for us?§ §  §We are 100% Kiwi owned and operated business. In addition to a great team environment, on-going training, we offer a competitive hourly wage. We have a real focus on our people and believe that it's OUR PEOPLE that will drive us to the next level of success.  §  §If you are interested in the role, please apply via the link below. §  §YOU MUST HAVE THE LEGAL RIGHT TO WORK IN NEW ZEALAND.  §  §Please Note: Only short-listed candidates will be contacted. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you available to work public holidays?§§§

jobText: TXT/50680261.txt	§Customer Care & Inbound Sales Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Care & Inbound Sales Representative§§Advertiser: §The People Place§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Mission§  § Primepac’s mission is to be indispensable to our customers, and to reward and inspire our team.  We are focused on dedication, initiative and reliability, and our relationships are based on integrity, loyalty, openness and respect. §  § At Primepac, we have a culture of continuous improvement, and we would like you to be a part of it!§  § §About the Role§  § We are seeking an enthusiastic and natural people person to join our Customer Care team in Auckland. As a Customer Care and Inbound Sales Representative, you will play an integral role in our business by providing impeccable customer care through all stages of customer interaction. Additionally, you will use your sales skills to sniff out opportunities to upsell or recommend products to clients when they ring in using your active questioning and listening capabilities.§  § §You will be responsible for:§ § §Quickly and accurately responding to customer requirements, whether it is via the phone, email or our website§ §Taking advantage of leads and opportunities for New Business§ §Managing a high volume of customer queries and processing of orders§ §Ensuring customers are kept in the loop and resolving any issues in a timely manner§ §Working closely with the wider divisions to ensure the process runs as smoothly as possible§ § Working 8am – 5pm, this Rosedale based role will reward those with the mindset of a problem solver, and the drive of a Salesperson.§ If your professional manner and capability shine through on the phone and you’ve always wanted to get some experience in Sales without having to cold call, this could be the role for you!§  § §Additionally, if you:§ § §Are passionate about providing impeccable service and going the extra mile§ §Have proven experience in a Customer Care role or similar§ §Exhibit the drive and energy to continuously learn, grow, and improve§ §Enjoy working at pace and producing results, even when under pressure§ §Pride yourself on your attention to detail and ability to multitask  § §Have exposure to diary and/or CRM management (ideally Salesforce)§ § Then we want to hear from you! Click 'apply now' to submit your resume and cover letter.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

To find out more about us go to www.skininstitute.co.nz.§This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of our existing Call Centre team of four people, engaging with our customers from around New Zealand.§The hours for this role will be Monday and Tuesday (our busiest time!) between 9am and 2.30pm, based at our Support Office in Takapuna.§About You§As the 'voice' of Skin Institute, you will have excellent customer service skills and be someone who engages warmly on the phone with people from all walks of life. In this role, you will take inbound calls and deal with web enquiries from all around New Zealand, so you will need to become familiar with services provided across all our clinics.§You will also be a capable administrator, with sound computer skills and be flexible in undertaking a range of administration tasks related to our busy clinic environment. You will also have excellent written communication skills, responding to web enquiries and conveying the right information to the right people.§ § §Knowledge of Patient Information software would be an advantage but is not essential as full training will be provided.§This role is a wonderful opportunity to become part of the wider team at the Skin Institute Group Support Office in Takapuna and to contribute to Skin Institute nationally.§Please apply with a covering letter to introduce yourself and a CV through our online application form.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§Do you have customer service experience?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many hours are you available to work per week?§§§

jobText: TXT/50691394.txt	§Customer Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Specialist§§Advertiser: §Pet Circle§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Customer Specialist§  § §About us§  § At Pet Circle, we want to create a world where pets and their families are healthy, happy and spend more time together. We make buying pet supplies and pet food online easy and convenient. Over the past nine years, we’ve grown to become one of Australia's Top 5 Online retailers and No.1 in the Online Pet industry. Recently we were awarded the "Fast Mover Award" at the Online Retail Industry Awards. We have a world-class NPS score and we need your help to continue delighting our customers and their pets!  §  § As the pet industry continues to grow, and our pets are holding bigger spaces in our hearts and homes than ever before, Pet Circle will continue to thrive. As a venture backed company, we have big goals for growth. We’ve scaled from 100 to over 300 people in the last 18 months alone. This is a unique opportunity in your career to be part of an exceptional growth story. §  § §The opportunity §  § Our mission is to engage with our community of pet families as their specialist for everything pet. This means we need our front-line Customer Specialist Team to be absolute specialists in our products, our business model and our customers. We’re currently building this new team of Customer Specialists to handle our more complex customer requests, from product advice and solutions through to retention, via multiple channels including phone, email and Live Chat. You will not only give advice and provide solutions, but build loyalty, advocacy and their lifetime value to Pet Circle. §  § §Working arrangements:§  § We are building a highly autonomous, empowered remote team across New Zealand - so you will be working from your home office. Specific working arrangements:§ § §You must have a good home office set-up, including desk, laptop (and second screen), headphones / headset, phone and a fast and reliable internet connection.§ §Full time (38 hours per week)§ §  § §Your responsibilities:§  § § §Deliver a best in class customer experience in a high-volume, customer service environment through multiple channels. You will be focused on our more complex customer requests including product advice and retention. § §Handle all customer queries with the goal of providing an efficient, effective resolution while delighting our customers, going above and beyond to build loyalty and advocacy§ §Deliver on all team and individual KPIs, including productivity targets and customer satisfaction metrics (CSat, NPS, Customer Lifetime Value and Retention Rates) § §Be open and receptive to feedback and coaching as we pride ourselves on living our continuous improvement mindset§ §Positively contribute to our passionate, pet-loving, customer-oriented, and results-driven team!§ §  § §Your ideal experience:§  § § §Minimum 2 years’ professional experience in a fast paced, results driven environment where you were managing internal or external customer requests. This may have been a contact centre, or a role with transferable skills eg. Executive Assistant, Recruiter, Event Planners, Medical receptionists. § §Experience working with online systems (CRM, ticketing systems, order management software is ideal)§ §Fast learner with strong fluency in Web Technologies and the Internet§ §Tertiary qualification desirable, but not mandatory§ §  § §What awesome looks like:§  § § §Exceptional English written and verbal communication skills - You can compose thoughtful, personalised responses to customers § §High EQ to truly connect with customers, ask quality questions and anticipating needs § §Customer centric mindset and natural tendency to go above and beyond to solve problems§ §Outcome-oriented / results driven - thrives on solving issues efficiently while giving an excellent experience § §Excellent problem solving and listening skills, using strong judgement and patience to manage the most complex customer requests  § §Resilience for troubleshooting & dealing with difficult stakeholders (you love turning these situations around) § §Strong time management skills and naturally well organised - You work efficiently within time constraints and are able to cope with a variety of demands and prioritise tasks § §High self-motivation & discipline to work effectively from home and independently resolve customer issues§ §High level professionalism and maturity § §Business Development skills – a willingness and a social style to engage with customers about purchase decisions.§ §  § §Our values:§  § § §Accountability - Promises are made, and promises are kept§ §Teamwork - Value the diverse backgrounds and expertise we all bring§ §Communication - Honest, clear and respectful§ §Continuous Improvement - Failure is OK, as long as we own it and learn from it§ §  § §Other benefits:§ § §Enjoy being part of a driven team with a collaborative culture that values decision-makers and action§ §Enjoy solid career progression in the continuously growing e-commerce industry while working alongside top-notch e-commerce professionals§ §Get the value of working with a great company without working for a big company (not just yet anyway!)§ §  § We have an incredibly passionate team, a leading brand, 500,000 customers and growing, and we’re only just getting started. So what are you waiting for!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Customer Service Representative - Fixed-term Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50641554.txt	§Customer Service Representative - Fixed-term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representative - Fixed-term§§Advertiser: §Vector§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§About us§ §We’re on a mission. We're changing the way we engage and use power through our innovation, and our customers throughout New Zealand & Australia are seeing the benefits of Advanced Smart Metering Services (AMS), and how it's helping them to manage their gas and electricity.§ §Vector's vision is to 'Create a new energy future' and the rollout of smart meters and smart metering services is a key part of this. Smart meters underpin the new energy future, by providing granular and real-time information about customer behaviour and energy usage, empowering new and innovative retail products, and enabling consumer participation in energy markets.§ §AMS combines large-scale field deployment and operations, with a cutting-edge data business focused on 'near real-time' delivery of big data and analytics to support the efficient functioning of the overall electricity markets in New Zealand and Australia.§ §About the role§ §As a part of our Welcome Centre team, you will provide exceptional customer service on behalf of our retail customers, ensuring resolution are found for all metering requests, queries and any disputes that come through as dealt with in timely manner. Your day will be filled with managing queries such as scheduling dates, appointments and ensuring all coordination is being carried out for successful field visits. In addition, you support and challenge work processes/procedures across business units and recommend improvements to customer experience and team where needed.§*Please note this is a fixed-term role until 31 December 2020.§ §Who we are looking for?§ §You'll bring some previous customer service or call centre experience. You're a great communicator and have the ability to communicate effectively with both internal and external customers.§ §You will also bring the following:§ § §Ability to handle customer complaints§ §Strong computer skills - Word and Excel§ §Attention to detail and accuracy in processing documentation§ §Personal resilience, positivity and enthusiasm§ §This is an opportunity to join and lead a positive and hardworking team. You will enjoy ensuring that good fun and hard work go hand in hand. You understand the value of internal relationships and enjoy leading a fast-paced, experienced team.§ §What we can offer you§ §Vector engages a workforce made up of people and teams with diverse skills, values, backgrounds and experiences. Vector respects and values people who are different from each other, including gender, ethnicity, disability, age, sexual orientation, race and religion. We were the first corporate Living Wage Accredited employer, and the first Accessibility Tick employer. We are, of course, Rainbow Tick accredited, and Vector also won three gongs at the 2019 Diversity Awards NZ, including the Supreme Award. Why wouldn't you want to work here.§§§§

be:§ § §Responding to customer enquiries, taking ownership through to resolution.§ §Building rapport with the customer by active listening and adapting communication style.§ §Running efficient case management and follow-up within agreed timeframes.§ §You will manage a majority of customer contact via phone, however, follow ups may be via written communication.§ §Keep up to date with processes and procedures to ensure accurate information is provided.§ §Qualifications§  §The ideal candidate will have:§ § §Vast experience in a customer services environment with a proven track record of offering exceptional customer service.§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§ §An outstanding phone manner – being able to express ideas, thoughts and concept clearly, using correct and appropriate language, organisation and structure.§ §Experience with Salesforce, CRM, Microsoft Dynamics and the full MS Office suite is an added benefit.§ §Great attention to detail and accuracy of work.§ §The ability to work with a sense of urgency and thrive working under pressure.§ §Have the ability to work with a diverse array of people and build successful working relationships both internal and external customers.§ §An ability to demonstrate flexibility and adaptability – thinking outside the box.§ §As this role is all about team work and working to KPIs and tight timeframes, we are after someone that can be relied on to have great punctuality and who has a proven attendance record.§  §Additional information§  §These opportunities are a great foot in The Warehouse Group door; offering loads of development and insight about the Warehouse Group business with some good fun and laughs along the way. We have some great staff perks and guarantee an energetic and fast paced environment. §  §You will need to be available to work 40 hours a week between 8:00am-6pm. You will have every second weekend off with one day of the week and a weekend day off in the alternating week!§  §Company Description§  §The Warehouse Group (TWG) is a New Zealand success story, founded by Sir Stephen Tindall and evolved from a single The Warehouse store to become one of the largest retailing groups in New Zealand with $3 billion in sales. TWG consists of six core retail brands: The Warehouse, Warehouse Stationery, Noel Leeming, Torpedo7, 1-day and TheMarket. We have 260+ retail stores, online stores as well as distribution centres throughout New Zealand. We also have two overseas sourcing offices located in China and India. We are a people-centred business with more than 12,000 team members across our locations§  §If this sounds like you, apply now and join the team!§§§§
