jobText: TXT/50687313.txt	§Customer Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Case Manager§§Advertiser: §Vodafone New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Company description:§We want to inspire people to capture the opportunities of a digital future and connect for a better future. That is why we are here. §At Vodafone we have changed the lives of billions of people for over 30 years. We made the first ever mobile phone call over 30 years ago. And we sent the first SMS: “Merry Christmas”. From taking 4G to the Moon and using big data for social to intelligent transport systems and emergency drones, we are still shaking things up. §Be part of a company which helps those who need it most. Whether teaching girls to code, providing connectivity to disaster hit areas or putting on our trainers and running for charity. §The future is exciting. Ready?§Job description:§Are you looking to work with an organisation that values diversity and inclusion, sustainability, wellbeing and connections to communities across Aotearoa?   §We value the diversity of thought, perspective, and backgrounds that our people bring to work with them every day. We support our communities through the Vodafone New Zealand Foundation with an ambitious goal to halve the number of disadvantaged young people in Aotearoa by 2027. Our world-leading wellbeing program supports your holistic wellness and connects you with the tools, skills and people that enable you to be at your best on a daily basis. § §Are you a customer service star? This is an opportunity for you to join our customer expert team – the X Squad  – and build a career by defining what customer experience should be! § § § §In this Christchurch-based role as a §Customer Case Manager§ you will take ownership of customer service cases and manage the delivery of our customer’s requirements. You will handle a variety of cases through the call queue and through call-backs which will involve service or technical case management as well as new sale or service orders. § § § §You will actively contribute to delivering awesome customer experiences and improved processes by identifying trends and insights and championing them with the wider Vodafone team for the benefit of all customers.  § § § §What will I be doing? § § §Own the customer relationship and communications through to resolution § §Ensure all cases are resolved in a timely manner through effective jeopardy management § §Demonstrate thought leadership by actively identifying changes which can continuously improve the service experience and processes for all our Vodafone customers § § § § §What will I bring? § § §Passion for Customer Experience with a proven ability to determine priorities to exceed the customer requirements and expectations § §Customer service experience, ideally with experience in issue resolution or case management § §Flexible & open attitude, helping the customer is your highest priority § §Technical understanding of telecommunications products and services is useful, but not a requirement § §Motivation to stay current with technology § §Excellent interpersonal skills & eagerness to learn § §The ability to work to deadlines and multitask while operating with multiple systems, procedures, and customers § § §  §This role works on a rotating Monday to Sunday roster (including public holidays) of which the current hours are between 8am – 9pm. These rosters are subject to change depending on business requirements. The start date for this new team will be Monday 16 November. §  §Joining the Vodafone whānau will stretch you, challenge you and provide opportunities you’ve been seeking to expand your career. You’ll engage in unique workplace experiences, be exposed to exciting and innovative technology, and gain opportunities for learning beyond Aotearoa.   §  §Me mahi tahi tātou mo te oranga o te katoa. We work together for the benefit of all. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

And we sent the first SMS: “Merry Christmas”. Whether teaching girls to code, providing connectivity to disaster hit areas or putting on our trainers and running for charity. §The future is exciting. Ready?§Job description:§Are you looking to work with an organisation that values diversity and inclusion, sustainability, wellbeing and connections to communities across Aotearoa?   §We value the diversity of thought, perspective, and backgrounds that our people bring to work with them every day. We support our communities through the Vodafone New Zealand Foundation with an ambitious goal to halve the number of disadvantaged young people in Aotearoa by 2027. Our world-leading wellbeing program supports your holistic wellness and connects you with the tools, skills and people that enable you to be at your best on a daily basis. § §Are you a customer service star? This is an opportunity for you to join our customer expert team – the X Squad – and build a career by defining what customer experience should be! § § § §In your new role as a §Customer Case Manager§ you will take ownership of customer service cases and manage the delivery of our customer’s requirements. You will handle a variety of cases through the call queue and through call-backs which will involve service or technical case management as well as new sale or service orders. § § § §You will actively contribute to delivering awesome customer experiences and improved processes by identifying trends and insights and championing them with the wider Vodafone team for the benefit of all customers.  § § § §What will I be doing? § § §Own the customer relationship and communications through to resolution § §Ensure all cases are resolved in a timely manner through effective jeopardy management § §Demonstrate thought leadership by actively identifying changes which can continuously improve the service experience and processes for all our Vodafone customers § § § § §What will I bring? § § §Passion for Customer Experience with a proven ability to determine priorities to exceed the customer requirements and expectations § §Customer service experience, ideally with experience in issue resolution or case management § §Flexible & open attitude, helping the customer is your highest priority § §Technical understanding of telecommunications products and services is useful, but not a requirement § §Motivation to stay current with technology § §Excellent interpersonal skills & eagerness to learn § §The ability to work to deadlines and multitask while operating with multiple systems, procedures, and customers § § §  §This role works on a rotating Monday to Sunday roster (including public holidays) of which the current hours are between 8am – 9pm. These rosters are subject to change depending on business requirements. The start date for this new team will be Monday 16 November. §  §Joining the Vodafone whānau will stretch you, challenge you and provide opportunities you’ve been seeking to expand your career. jobTitle: Business Connector Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50671449.txt	§Business Connector§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Connector§§Advertiser: §Business Hawke's Bay§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Business Hawke’s Bay is establishing the Hawke’s Bay Business Hub Hastings. It’s an extension of the very successful Hawke’s Bay Business Hub Ahuriri, which is recognised nationally as an outstanding example of regional business support and collaboration. §  §This is a part-time, fixed term Business Connector role, and is vital in connecting Hawke’s Bay businesses with the services and wider support networks available locally and through national agencies. §  §About the Role:§ § §Connect clients with Business Hub partners, making referrals, appointments, and offering services as appropriate.§ §Work closely with Business Hawke’s Bay team members and Hub partners and sponsors to align connections and referrals.§ §Ensure the Hub premises are maintained to a high standard for use by our clients, partners, and sponsors. § §Manage event planning including advertising, websites and social media, location, ordering and co-ordination of equipment, refreshments, invitee and attendance lists, together with management of the agreed budget.§ §Contribute to maintaining Business Hawke’s Bay partnership and engagement processes, systems, and procedures.§ §Utilise the online visitor management system to check-in new general enquiries to the HBBH Hastings together with the room booking system to manage and optimise room availability.§ §The Business Connector may be required to work different days and hours on occasion to perform the role, including attending meetings and functions outside of normal working hours.§ §About You:§ § §A genuine interest in businesses, the people who work in them and supporting their development, together with business acumen and the ability to develop rapport.§ §Demonstrated experience of customer service, co-ordination and support skills.§ §Strong administrative and marketing support skills, ideally with a relevant qualification in an office, administration, or marketing discipline.§ §Proven ability in developing and maintaining strong relationships with clients, and internal and external partners.§ §Demonstrated experience in event organisation and management.§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively and work successfully with people from a diverse range of backgrounds.§ §Demonstrate awareness of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and including Te Reo Māori in relevant and practical ways in interaction and engagement to demonstrate respect and value of Tikanga Māori in appropriate settings. § §Self-motivation, energy and initiative.§ §Strong accuracy and attention to detail skills.§ §Experience with the Microsoft Office suite of applications including Word, PowerPoint and Outlook, together with a sound working knowledge of database management and CRM software.§ §Willingness to work across our Business Hub sites in Ahuriri and Hastings and travel across the wider Hawkes Bay region.§ §Ability to work occasional evenings to support workshops and events.§ §Current clean Driver’s Licence.§ §We work in a small team so your actions will count; working collaboratively within the team supporting the smooth running of the Hawke’s Bay Business Hub across the region.§  §If you have the skills and experience we are looking for then apply now providing an up to date CV and cover letter.§  §For a confidential discussion about the role please contact §Louise Penprase§ on louise@businesshb.nz or 021 710219.§  §Applications close on Friday 16th October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50654803.txt	§Customer Service Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representative§§Advertiser: §Datacom§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Our purpose§Datacom Connect brings together in-depth business knowledge and innovation to design rapidly deployable smart solutions to enable the ‘connected customer'. With three focus areas; Customer Experience Operations, Customer Experience Platforms and Customer Experience Automation, we take care of a bunch of companies and services to ensure the most effective and efficient customer experience.§The Nitty Gritty§We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds§. §We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.§§About the Role §We are looking for a friendly, professional team player who is passionate about delivering an exceptional level of customer service. Your effective communication skills will be key to success in this role. We handle nearly 100,000 enquiries from customers every year and are here 365 days per year helping Kiwi's and visitors from all over the world experience one of New Zealand's most iconic journeys.§§What you'll do §Helping customers to address their needs or answer their queries over the phone§Searching for solution-based outcomes that ensure customers feel valued§Building lasting relationships with customers and colleagues based on trust and reliability§Consistently striving to provide outstanding customer service§Adhere to all company service standards§§What you'll bring §A desire to always provide exceptional customer service §Be a great team player§Dedication to meeting both customer and client expectations§Positive and professional attitude§Proficiency with computers and strong typing skills§Attention to detail§Strong time management and decision-making skills§§If this sounds like the opportunity you're after, apply now!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What is your expected annual salary?§How many weeks' notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50673021.txt	§Customer Success Agent§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Success Agent§§Advertiser: §Hnry Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§About the business§ § §Hnry are rapidly growing in New Zealand and have recently expanded into Australia. Due to increasing customer numbers on both sides of the Tasman, we are looking to add a superstar to our current team to help deliver the best possible experience for our customers and partners.§ §Customers are at the heart of everything Hnry does and this role provides a great opportunity to really help make a difference for people. This role is about being a champion for customers, whilst getting first-hand experience of working in a fast-paced environment, and working hard as part of a highly motivated and results-driven team.§ §Reporting into the Customer Success Lead, this is not a traditional Call Centre role - there are no scripts, every customer is unique and needs to be treated as such. The Customer Success Agent is responsible for developing customer relationships that promote retention and loyalty, working closely with customers to ensure they are engaged, excited and satisfied with the service they receive, as well as canvassing customers on areas where we could improve.§ § §About the role§ § §Your responsibilities will include:§ §Providing frontline support to customers, answering queries about our systems and service raised via web chat, email and phone§Helping to correctly set up customer profiles in the Hnry system, and managing customer data§Conducting follow-up calls with new customers and providing them with assistance as required§Managing customer feedback/engagement§Writing/maintaining online help articles§Educating customers on the capabilities of Hnry so they are encouraged to continue using and promoting the service§Adhering to established customer support practices to ensure customers receive the same quality of service regardless of who they deal with§Providing feedback to technical staff and the wider team to optimise the customer experience based on customer interactions§ § §Benefits and perks§ §We invest in our people, and provide opportunities for career growth and progression§We encourage experimentation - whether that's experimenting with new tools or techniques, or experimenting with new channels§We work hard and we finish on time, no crazy hours§Pizza Wednesdays§Eligibility for the company ESOP scheme§ § §Skills and experience§ § §Must Haves§Be a self-starter that takes initiative and seeks out ways to make things more efficient§Have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and changing environment§Be a team player who is willing to muck in§Have strong verbal and written communication skills (good phone manner, spelling, grammar are critical)§Have fantastic interpersonal skills, and in particular a strong empathetic personality§Have a strong attention to detail, organisational skills§Be self-sufficient, and able to work both independently §Be proficient in Google suite or other office software§Be financially literate with a rudimentary understanding of NZ Tax obligations for individuals§Have technical aptitude and the ability to learn software programs§Have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa§ §For Bonus Points §Previous experience with customer service tools such as Intercom§Experience being self-employed (freelancing, contracting etc) in any industry/profession§Experience of working in a fast-paced, agile workplace§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50674393.txt	§Customer Relations Representative (Fixed Term)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Relations Representative (Fixed Term)§§Advertiser: §Yellow Umbrella§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§There’s a successful, award winning, family owned company in Rotorua that thinks progressively, acts sustainably, and puts excellence at the forefront of their services, AND they happen to be looking for a like-minded individual to join their tight-knit team and take care of our inbound customers via the Customer Relations Representative role.§ §In this role you'll be asked to deliver friendly, professional and efficient Customer Services while also providing support to the Sales & Marketing team, assisting with Office and Administrative§tasks, Warehouse duties, and maintaining the§Showroom area.§ §It's all about playing your role in ensuring the Company delivers “outstanding” service to all its customers by satisfying and exceeding their expectations.§ §About the company:§ §Jasco’s story began some 40 years ago. Through dedication, innovation and responsiveness, the company has grown to become one of the largest independent wholesale distributors servicing the business to business sectors throughout New Zealand.§ §They’re built on strong traditional values, with emphasis on people and team culture, as well as a commitment to social and environmental responsibility. Their philosophy is to "Make a Beneficial Difference", so critical to your success will be your dedication and genuine intention to build strong customer relationships.§ §About the ideal candidate:§ §Jasco have a real growth mindset that spills over into their openness to taking on people with aptitude and attitude over  experience and expertise, however the ideal candidate will have the following:§ § §You'll have a great personality and you won't be afraid to use it!§ §You'll be personable yet professional .§ §You'll be confident, resilient and self-assured just incase we get some not-so-stoked customers.§ §Be drawn to serve others and have a genuine heart to get stuck in and help.§ §Be hungry, growing and driven to succeed - coz who knows this role might lead to some cool career opportunities!§ §This is a full-time fixed-term position to cover maternity leave, so while their may easily be a chance to join the team permanently, the role will initially be for 6 to 12 months.§ §We’d love to hear from you if you’re interested and believe you’re fit for the role.§ §While we will review the contents of your CV, we will read your cover letter with interest so feel free to entertain us with a summary of who you are and why you’re applying for this role!§ §Only those with the rights to work in New Zealand need apply.§ §Any queries please contact: §nicola@yellowumbrella.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

and racing with your exceptional customer service skills.§You will:-§Provide outstanding first level support and fault/problem resolution to our TAB customers§Consistently deliver exceptional customer service and ensure a great customer experience through resolution of queries, resolving complaints and issues when necessary§Take care of our callers by being upbeat, proactive, and calm under pressure§Work collaboratively in a team environment§Hours of work§Our Contact Centre is open from 8.30am – 6pm Sunday – Thursday and from 8.30am – 8pm on a Friday and Saturday. Working on a casual basis you will be required to cover weekdays, weekends, nights and public holiday work.  In essence, we're looking for people to be available as the we move in to our busy Spring and Summer period, and to also cover Annual Leave, Sick Leave, and high volume event periods.§With this in mind it is essential that people are available to cover certain key dates, in particular:-§Week com 12th or 19th of October – 1 - 2 weeks full-time, Training §Week com 2nd of November – Melbourne Cup week§What we are looking for§Experience in dealing with customers to provide outstanding support and a passion to provide a good customer experience§Confident manner with the ability to think ‘on your feet’ and the ability to build strong rapport and communicate effectively§Technologically savvy with fast and accurate data entry skills§A great work ethic and pride in your work alongside good communication skills alongside being good with numbers§Ability to deal with tough situations in a calm and professional manner§Previous experience in a customer service environment is essential§What we can offer you§A comprehensive training programme within an exciting entertainment industry§Lots of flexibility around shift patterns to fit in with you current lifestyle.§Onsite cafe complete with the best barista made coffee§We are holding interviews immediately, so don't delay please apply now!§§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§

You'll have a keen interest and passion for the local agriculture industry, and your excellent communication skills will set you apart.§Duties and responsibilities:§Provide sound advice to a variety of customers based on their needs§Pro-actively solve queries and problems from customers, suppliers and other staff§Process sales and product requests with efficiency§Order, unpack and display merchandise according to company guidelines§Undertake Forklift, Ute and trailer driving and delivery duties.§Skills and experience:§Previous experience in the New Zealand rural sector is essential§A full, current and clean New Zealand driver's licence§Experience driving and backing trailers is highly desired§A team player who can roll up their sleeves and contribute to outstanding results§Good physical fitness as regular heavy lifting is required§Previous retail and/or sales experience is an advantage but not essential§Proficiency with Microsoft Office and Outlook is essential.§We are committed to growing our employees and we develop leadership and technical expertise at all levels of our company. jobText: TXT/50702580.txt	§Inbound Sales Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Inbound Sales Consultant§§Advertiser: §GRAVITY INTERNET LIMITED§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Sales - Inbound§§§§§§Gravity Internet is New Zealand’s only dedicated satellite internet provider. We are a proudly owned and operated Kiwi business and have been hard at work for the last 5 years connecting rural properties, families, farms and businesses to the fastest broadband they have EVER seen! Since launching our new product range at the start of 2020 we have seen significant growth which means we are now looking for passionate and driven individuals to join with us to take us to the next level!§We are looking for a driven sales professional with a passion for customer service to join our friendly team based in Auckland. The primary responsibility of this role is to grow and develop our customer base, whilst providing a key support role to our Commercial Team. The role requires a high level of customer interaction – primarily telesales focused.§Key responsibilities for this role include:§ §Dealing with inbound sales enquiries via phone and email§Managing the sales process through the CRM and making sure it’s always up to date§Managing follow-up sales calls to ensure all leads are covered§Negotiating deals, closing sales and achieving targets§Identifying new opportunities by remaining current on industry trends and feedback from customers§Supporting the wider sales and commercial teams in achieving goals and targets§The ideal candidate for this role would possess the following experience and attributes:§Min. 2 years of experience in a call centre or customer service environment§A passion for dealing with retail customers in a B2C capacity§Experience managing a sales process from first contact through to conclusion§IT skills in Microsoft Office and CRM management (ideally Zoho)§An approachable, friendly and professional communication style§A proven ability to think on your feet and offer creative solutions§Experience working independently with minimal supervision§In return for your hard work and dedication we offer a competitive salary + bonuses. We are a social workplace so we have staff lunches, drinks and quarterly incentive trips and experiences to keep you interested!§If you believe you have the relevant experience and skills, as well as an approach to customer service that goes above and beyond, then we would love to hear from you.§Please note that only applicants with the current right to work in NZ will be considered.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50687152.txt	§Personal Insurance Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Insurance Consultant§§Advertiser: §IAG NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Personal Insurance Consultant §      §        §Our Contact Centres are an awesome place to be - we have a diverse and inclusive culture that supports a whole of life approach that we're proud of. We're currently looking for more talented people to join us on our journey to help make our world a safer place.§        §We're in the business of protecting the things that are important to our customers. You'll fit in here if you always have customers at the forefront of your mind, are able to ask the right questions to identify your customer needs and then develop the right solutions for them.§        §What you'll do:§        §As one of our Personal Insurance Consultants, you'll have proactive conversations to ensure everyone you speak to will be better insured and/or better-educated about insurance by the time they hang up the phone with you. You'll ask the right questions to understand more about each customer's immediate and future needs, and then discuss the features and benefits of the right solutions to protect their vehicle, house, contents and other assets. We want to set our customers up for a positive experience when they need to make a claim, so it's important to ensure they understand their cover completely and know exactly what to expect when they suffer a loss.§        §We need to be here for our customers whenever they need us, so our centre is open 7 days a week (Monday to Friday 8am - 8pm & Saturday to Sunday 9am - 6pm). Our shifts rotate to cover these days and hours, so you'll work 75 hours per fortnight (10 x 7.5-hour shifts). This may include one weekend day every fortnight.§        §What we're looking for:§        §We're seeking people who can build a natural rapport with customers over the phone, and who really want to help to make their world a safer place. You'll bring strong customer service experience but be ready for a new challenge. You'll be adept at uncovering customer needs using your inbound or outbound calling experience and finding the right solutions for them. A positive attitude goes a long way, as well as wanting to build genuine connections with your customers and colleagues. You'll really be immersed in the world of insurance and will need to absorb a lot of technical information, but we will set you up for success with a robust training plan and ongoing support and development.§        §Who are we:§        §IAG is NZ's largest general insurer and operates under the State, AMI, NZI, and Lumley brands, as well as underwriting insurance for some of NZ's leading banks. At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions.§        §What we can offer you:§        §          §A positive working environment with loads of support§          §Internal development opportunities§          §Discretionary annual performance bonus and annual salary reviews§          §50% discount on IAG insurance (with any of IAG's brands)§          §Annual $500 Health & Wellness benefit after being with the company for more than 12 months§          §Opportunity to join the IAG employee share plan, along with a company contribution§          §Corporate discounts at various retailers e.g. Noel Leeming, OPSM, Bunnings, BNZ and more!§        §        §You will need the ability to work from home with Broadband installed. You'll be supported with an intensive training programme to get you across all elements of our products and systems. This is followed by ongoing coaching to help you develop and hone all of the skills you will need to become a successful Personal Insurance Consultant.§        §If you believe you have what it takes to excel in this role, then start applying now!§        §Applications close Monday 19th of October at 5.00pm.§      §      §Jess Opai§Jess.Opai@iag.co.nz§ §      §      §For further information visit careers.iag.co.nz§    §    §  §§§Our Contact Centres are an awesome place to be - we have a diverse and inclusive culture that supports a whole of life approach that we're proud of. We're currently looking for more talented people to join us on our journey to help make our world a safer place.§We're in the business of protecting the things that are important to our customers. Our shifts rotate to cover these days and hours, so you'll work 75 hours per fortnight (10 x 7.5-hour shifts). This may include one weekend day every fortnight.§What we're looking for:§We're seeking people who can build a natural rapport with customers over the phone, and who really want to help to make their world a safer place. You'll bring strong customer service experience but be ready for a new challenge. We want to set our customers up for a positive experience when they need to make a claim, so it's important to ensure they understand their cover completely and know exactly what to expect when they suffer a loss.§We need to be here for our customers whenever they need us, so our centre is open 7 days a week (Monday to Friday 8am - 8pm & Saturday to Sunday 9am - 6pm). Our shifts rotate to cover these days and hours, so you'll work 75 hours per fortnight (10 x 7.5-hour shifts). This may include one weekend day every fortnight.§What we're looking for:§We're seeking people who can build a natural rapport with customers over the phone, and who really want to help to make their world a safer place. You'll bring strong customer service experience but be ready for a new challenge. You'll be adept at uncovering customer needs using your inbound or outbound calling experience and finding the right solutions for them. A positive attitude goes a long way, as well as wanting to build genuine connections with your customers and colleagues. You'll really be immersed in the world of insurance and will need to absorb a lot of technical information, but we will set you up for success with a robust training plan and ongoing support and development.§Who are we:§IAG is NZ's largest general insurer and operates under the State, AMI, NZI, and Lumley brands, as well as underwriting insurance for some of NZ's leading banks. At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions.§What we can offer you:§A positive working environment with loads of support§Internal development opportunities§Discretionary annual performance bonus and annual salary reviews§50% discount on IAG insurance (with any of IAG's brands)§Annual $500 Health & Wellness benefit after being with the company for more than 12 months§Opportunity to join the IAG employee share plan, along with a company contribution§Corporate discounts at various retailers e.g. Noel Leeming, OPSM, Bunnings, BNZ and more!§You will need the ability to work from home with Broadband installed. You'll be supported with an intensive training programme to get you across all elements of our products and systems. This is followed by ongoing coaching to help you develop and hone all of the skills you will need to become a successful Personal Insurance Consultant.§If you believe you have what it takes to excel in this role, then start applying now!§Applications close Monday 19th of October at 5.00pm.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

You love the challenge of a fast paced performance environment, and you understand the importance of customer service and know how to influence others so you can achieve in your role.§  §You're motivated, practical and you're already good at what you do but you're ready to take on a new role with our team at Fliway. We're one of the largest fully integrated logistics providers operating in New Zealand, offering our customers solutions from international freight to warehousing and domestic delivery to both businesses and homes.§  §You also like the fact that we pay competitively, offer scope for advancement, and we're located close to Auckland airport with parking - meaning this Monday to Friday role is perfect for you.§  §The What and Who...§  §Reporting to the Client Operations Team Leader as part of a high-performing team, you'll be the key point of contact for assigned accounts, ensuring all customer enquiries are actioned in a professional manner within the agreed timeframe and up to the service standard. You are responsible for developing a pro-active relationship with nominated Key Customer Accounts and a clear understanding of the business needs and goals for these customer accounts. You will also support the wider business dealing with a wide range of stakeholders in the pursuit of success for both the internal business and nominated Key Customer Accounts.§  §Previous working knowledge of transport, freight or logistics will definitely be a bonus, but the core requirements of this role mean that you've got awesome adaptability - embracing new practises and responding positively to change, attention to detail, a great customer style, strong communication skills and you thrive when delivering under pressure.§  §What's more, you'll be proficient at Microsoft Office applications, excellent at Excel and be a quick learner in other relevant systems, teamed with having strong problem-solving and analytical skills.§  §Ultimately you never lose sight of the customer experience and you take pride in ensuring we deliver our promise.§  §We are looking for someone with a bright personality who has the ability to build and maintain effective relationships with a range of stakeholders in the position.§  §The How, When and Where ...§  §So, if you are ready for a new challenge in a fast-paced environment then this is the opportunity for you, APPLY now! Ideally:§ § §Previous call centre management experience is essential to succeed§ §Demonstrated leadership qualities that inspire and motivate staff§ §Excellent communication and negotiation skills§ §Professional work manner and one that facilitates an environment where all staff can reach their full potential§ §Knowledge of call centre technologies and project management methodologies§ §Ability to build and maintain good working relationships§ §Ability to analyse data and present key findings§ §Previous experience with omni channel or digital services preferred§ §Available to work a flexible roster Monday to Friday (however ability to be on call in case of emergencies)§ § § §Now let’s talk about what your day to day could involve:§ § §Provide Leadership that motivates teams to achieve performance and quality targets§ §Assist your leaders in managing agent behaviours and performance plans if required§ §Be involved in recruitment, induction and training of new hires§ §Ensure your leaders are equipped to successfully manage their team§ §Be an open communicator with an approachable management style§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50671921.txt	§Operations Adviser - Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Adviser - Wellington§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Fixed Term Contract till 31st July 2021§You must be able to start training on the 2nd November 2020§Application progressed you must be able to attend an Assessment Centre on the 14th October 2020§Competitive salary: $57,398 - 67,527§§ §Are you looking for a role in which you can work with exciting technology and dedicated people while making a difference to the communities we live in? This could be the job for you.§Our Operations Advisers are part of 24/7 teams based at the Department of Corrections based in the Wellington Region. We assist frontline staff in the management of over 4000 electronically monitored offenders and defendants around NZ. Our tight-knit teams are busy, focused and committed to keeping the community safe. The environment is dynamic, fast paced, and energetic.§Any given shift in these teams will involve important responsibilities such as liaising with Police to coordinate a welfare check or the arrest of a high risk individual, assisting a Probation Officer in the management of their offender, or problem-solving over the phone with offenders or defendants who are facing difficult and stressful situations.§This is a demanding role - the phones can be exceptionally busy and no two days will be the same. People who are successful in this role will possess the following attributes:§§The ability to communicate and engage clearly with people from all different cultures and backgrounds§Integrity and professionalism§People skills and a sense of humour§Resilience to deal with shift work, challenging people and situations§Strong computer literacy§The ability to make sound decisions whilst adhering to process and established frameworks.§§Although a degree or experience in a relevant field would be beneficial, we value life experience, the ability to work the required shift patterns and a "can do attitude". This is a fantastic opportunity to kick-start your career in the Department of Corrections.§You will be using modern GPS technology and software. While training will be provided for these platforms, you must also be competent with Microsoft applications including Outlook, Word, and Excel.You can expect to be challenged, but also to leave each shift with a sense of satisfaction that comes from making an important contribution towards managing the people in our care and keeping our community safe.§Operations Advisers in our teams work a mixture of shifts 6am-4pm, 12-10pm, 8.30pm-6.30am, which will change on a rotational basis Monday-Sunday including public holidays. Please note that for all shift pattern options above, approximately four weeks of 9am-5pm Monday-Friday will be required for initial training when the role begins§Remuneration range: $57,398 - 67,527 (starting rate within the range may be negotiable based on relevant experience).§§Mō mātou | §About us§§Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us by Iwi and conveys the responsibility we have to support and guide those in our care to reach their potential.  Our strategy, Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5), provides a clear direction of travel - one that builds on the good things that are already happening, and, most importantly, how we can innovate to find new ways of doing things to achieve better outcomes for Māori, whānau and communities. §§Tono ināianei | Apply Now§To apply, submit your§ tailored CV and a cover letter (PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join Ara Poutama and highlighting your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role.  §It is an exciting time and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site.  If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50679984.txt	§Māngai Hangarau§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Māngai Hangarau§§Advertiser: §Vocus Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Māngai Hangarau §      §        §He mīharo a Slingshot hei wāhi mahi, ā, kei te hiahia mātou ki ētahi kaimahi mīharo mō tō mātou puni Te Reo Māori hou.§        §Ka kawe te puni nei i te ngākau whiwhita o Slingshot mō te ratonga kiritaki, waihoki, ka whakarawe āwhina ā-reo Māori ki ngā kiritaki o Slingshot - ahakoa mā te huarahi o te waea, te īmēra, te kōrerorero ā-tuihono.§        §E whakapono ana mātou he tuatahitanga tēnei mō tētahi rangatōpū o Aotearoa, ā, he hiahia nui tō mātou kia whai i ngā kaimahi kaiora kia hiki i tēnei kaupapa ki taumata ikeike.§        §Te Tūranga§        §He tūranga ukiuki ā-waea, ā-īmēra anō hoki tēnei e mahi ana kei raro i te maru o tō mātou Pū Whakapāpā. Ko te nuinga o te wā ka mahi koe ki tō ake kāinga, ā, ko ngā pātai ki te reo Māori (kāore e kore ko ētahi ki te reo Pākehā anō hoki) ka tukuna atu ki a koe.§        §Ko te āhuatanga o tētahi rā māori ki tēnei tūranga ko te tuku kōrero āwhina e hāngai ana ki ngā pātai hangarau ā-kāinga, te whakarongoā i ngā raru hangarau o ngā kiritaki, te whaiwhai atu i ngā raru kua tohua kētia, me te tautoko i ngā kiritaki kia whai rongoā. Ko te katoa o tēnā me te mātua aro anō hoki ki te whakatinanatanga o te whai hua ā-ipurangi a ngā kiritaki.§        §Ki te whakaaro koe he haepapa nui tēnā, kaua e māharahara, kua whakatauhia e mātou te 2.5 wiki te roa o tētahi hōtaka whakangūngū ā-Huitopa kia whakaakongia ngā āhuatanga katoa kia rite pai koe ki te kōkiri i ngā haepapa mahi - waihoki ka tuku atu ki a koe te katoa o ngā taputapu rorohiko kia whakatutuki pai koe i ngā mahi, ā, ka riro hoki i a koe tētahi nama $80 ia marama kia tāpae atu ki tō hononga ipurangi.§        §Ka mahi tahi koe me tētahi ranga papai rawa me tā rātou kaha āwhina, kaha tautoko anō hoki mai i te timatanga. Ko tō mātou hiahia i a koe ko te paku mōhiotanga ki ngā āhuatanga hangarau, kia kounga tō reo Māori ā-waha, ā-tuhi anō hoki, kia tū koe hei tangata ngākau āhwina, ka mutu, kei a koe te āheinga kia ohia te hanga o te whakaaro!§        §Ko te katoa o tēnā mai i te āhurutanga o tō ake kāinga.§        §Ngā pūkenga me ngā āheinga me mātua kite§        §          §Me matatau i te reo Māori ā-tuhi, ā-waha anō hoki§          §Me kounga te reo Pākehā ā-tuhi, ā-waha anō hoki§          §Kia pai te taumata pūkenga rorohiko me te tere o te patopato§          §Kua 1-2 tau te roa o tō whai wheako ki tētahi Pū Whakapāpā, ki tētahi tūranga ratonga kiritaki rānei e āhua rite ana ki tēnei§          §E ngākau whakapuke ana ki te hangarau§          §Me mātua whakapuāwai ki roto i tētahi taiao terenga-kakama§          §E ngākau whiwhita ana kia whai rongoā, kia āwhina tāngata anō hoki§        §        §Ngā paearu/ngā māraurautanga kia mahi ki tō ake kāinga§        §          §Me mātua mārōrō te hononga ipurangi me te āheinga kia hono mā te itarangi§          §He wāhi mahi ngū kia tutuki pai ngā whiwhinga waea§          §Tētahi waea pūkoro§        §        §Ngā Hua§        §          §Ka āhei te whiwhi i ngā āpititanga utu ā-tau tae atu ki te $6000§          §Ka riro i tētahi nama $80 ia marama kia tāpae atu ki tētahi ratonga ipurangi Slingshot, ki tētahi ratonga ipurangi Orcon rānei§          §Tētahi hōtaka whakangūngū e 2.5 wiki te roa, ā, ka utua hoki e koe§          §Kua wātea e koe te mahi ki tō ake kāinga§          §Ka riro i te $300 hei moni āwhina mō te whare whakapakari tinana§          §Ka riro i te ōrautanga āwhina, arā te 50% mai i te utu o tētahi inihua hauora mō ngā kaimahi ukiuki§        §        §He kōrero whakamārama mō Slingshot (me tōna rāngai matua a Vocus)§        §Ka manaakitia o mātou nuinga, ka pōwhiritia te ahurea kanorau, ā, ka whakanuia ngā hunga ka eke ki taumata ikeike. I te pō, i te ao e kimi ana mātou i ngā hunga rikarika, i ngā hunga koi, otirā i ngā hunga ngākau hihiko.§        §Kua waihangatia e mātou tētahi taiao ā-ranga pai me tētahi ahurea whaiwhai hua, ā, ahakoa kei te kāinga te nuinga o a mātou kaimahi e mahi ana, ka hiki tonu mātou i tētahi taiao hihiko mā te whakatū i ngā huihuinga ā-ranga, mā te whakahaere i tētahi karapu whakangahau, ā, mā te whakahaere i ngā momo whakapoapoatanga, i ngā momo whakataetae ā-marama anō hoki. Mehemea e āhua rite ana koe ki a mātou, arā, he tangata whakaaro kaikaha, he kaha koe ki te kimi huarahi kia whakapai ake i tētahi āhuatanga, he ngākaunui tōu kia mahitahi me te hunga tangata, ā, e hiahia ana koe ki te whakawhanake i a koe anō, kāti, ka mātua tau tō noho ki waenganui i a mātou.§        §I a koe ngā pūkenga me te ngākau uruhi kia piri mai ki te ranga? Pāwhiria te 'apply', ā, tīmatatia tō para i te ara o Vocus.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§He mīharo a Slingshot hei wāhi mahi, ā, kei te hiahia mātou ki ētahi kaimahi mīharo mō tō mātou puni Te Reo Māori hou.§Ka kawe te puni nei i te ngākau whiwhita o Slingshot mō te ratonga kiritaki, waihoki, ka whakarawe āwhina ā-reo Māori ki ngā kiritaki o Slingshot - ahakoa mā te huarahi o te waea, te īmēra, te kōrerorero ā-tuihono.§E whakapono ana mātou he tuatahitanga tēnei mō tētahi rangatōpū o Aotearoa, ā, he hiahia nui tō mātou kia whai i ngā kaimahi kaiora kia hiki i tēnei kaupapa ki taumata ikeike.§Te Tūranga§He tūranga ukiuki ā-waea, ā-īmēra anō hoki tēnei e mahi ana kei raro i te maru o tō mātou Pū Whakapāpā. jobText: TXT/50638737.txt	§Customer Services Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Services Manager§§Advertiser: §PACT§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Management & Support§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Customer Services Manager §      §Viscount FCC | Mt Wellington §      §        §About the Company:§        §Our Vision is to lead the circular economy through reuse, recycling and packaging solutions§        §Viscount FCC is a subsidiary of the multinational §PACT Group Pty §and supplies New Zealand fresh produce growers with high quality returnable packaging solutions. Our crates, pallets and bins are of the highest quality and are designed to meet all our customers packaging requirements, enhance the shelf life of their products, and increase the marketability of their produce through retailer preference of our equipment§        §We're known for our innovation, customer intimacy and our ability to deliver unique customised solutions to the industry. We're seeking an experienced and motivated individual for this varied and challenging role.§        § §About the Role:§        §Newly created role! Reporting to the General Manager, you will manage the daily interface with customers, ensuring that our customers' needs are met either directly or indirectly, in a timely and professional manner. You will deal largely with account netting (data transfers from major customers), including but not limited to support with forecasting, customer queries, managing the customer pre order system, outbound customer calling, inbound customer queries, account set up etc. Processing new account applications and updating master data will also form part of the role.  §        §What we're looking for§        §We are looking for an established Customer Service Manager preferably from FMCG / Manufacturing / Packaging background. In addition, you will be able to articulate your achievements and expertise in the following:§        §          §Successfully running a customer service and order management function in a SME/high growth FMCG / Manufacturing / Packaging business§          §Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport and work with stakeholders internally and externally§          §Self-starter who is enthusiastic, motivated, passionate who takes pride in the work they do and the standards they deliver§          §Knowledge of sales and marketing§          §Ability to find innovative solutions to meet customer requirements§          §Thrive in a fast-paced environment, working under pressure and being obsessive about delivering a market leading customer experience§          §Working knowledge of SAP would be advantageous§        §        §We are offering:§        §          §Competitive salary package§          §Discounted health insurance premiums through Southern Cross§          §Discounted rates and savings through our anz@work benefits program§        §        §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. §        §If you are looking for a role you can stay in long term, grow your experience and be rewarded with an exciting experience this is the role for you.§        § §      §      §      §    §  §§§About the Company:§ §Our Vision is to lead the circular economy through reuse, recycling and packaging solutions§ §Viscount FCC is a subsidiary of the multinational §PACT Group Pty §and supplies New Zealand fresh produce growers with high quality returnable packaging solutions. Our crates, pallets and bins are of the highest quality and are designed to meet all our customers packaging requirements, enhance the shelf life of their products, and increase the marketability of their produce through retailer preference of our equipment§ §We're known for our innovation, customer intimacy and our ability to deliver unique customised solutions to the industry. We're seeking an experienced and motivated individual for this varied and challenging role.§ § §About the Role:§ §Newly created role! Reporting to the General Manager, you will manage the daily interface with customers, ensuring that our customers' needs are met either directly or indirectly, in a timely and professional manner. You will deal largely with account netting (data transfers from major customers), including but not limited to support with forecasting, customer queries, managing the customer pre order system, outbound customer calling, inbound customer queries, account set up etc. Processing new account applications and updating master data will also form part of the role.  § §What we're looking for§ §We are looking for an established Customer Service Manager preferably from FMCG / Manufacturing / Packaging background. In addition, you will be able to articulate your achievements and expertise in the following:§ § §Successfully running a customer service and order management function in a SME/high growth FMCG / Manufacturing / Packaging business§ §Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport and work with stakeholders internally and externally§ §Self-starter who is enthusiastic, motivated, passionate who takes pride in the work they do and the standards they deliver§ §Knowledge of sales and marketing§ §Ability to find innovative solutions to meet customer requirements§ §Thrive in a fast-paced environment, working under pressure and being obsessive about delivering a market leading customer experience§ §Working knowledge of SAP would be advantageous§ §We are offering:§ § §Competitive salary package§ §Discounted health insurance premiums through Southern Cross§ §Discounted rates and savings through our anz@work benefits program§ §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. § §If you are looking for a role you can stay in long term, grow your experience and be rewarded with an exciting experience this is the role for you.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50680449.txt	§Customer Service & Checkouts Team 2IC §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service & Checkouts Team 2IC §§Advertiser: §Mitre 10§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Customer Service & Checkouts Team 2IC §      §        §Are you keen to put your leadership skills to work and join a strong Kiwi business in growth mode? Not only are we growing as a business, we are proud to be voted New Zealand’s most trusted home improvement brand. §        §Mitre 10 Mega Nelson, is a dynamic and growing business with a vision to provide great quality products and the best value and expertise to enable our customers to have an affordable and easy DIY experience. §        §This is a key role within our store, requiring a quick thinking and capable person to join our busy Customer Services front desk and Checkouts team. This position requires the successful applicant to deal with customer and team enquiries, telephone calls, finance applications, product location, checkout sales and all the other ‘one off’ situations that arise on a day to day basis. The customer service desk is the face of our business, so we are looking for that special someone. §        §The Check-Out team often deliver the first and last impression of our business and the person we seek to supervise this area must have the ability to remain cool under pressure and be able to think on their feet. §        §To be successful you must have: §        §• a passion for providing excellent customer service each and every time; §        §• be a detail minded self-starter; §        §• Strong mathematical skills; §        §• be able to multi-task, and have the ability to follow through and follow up situations in a timely manner; §        §• experience in conflict resolution and confidence to make decisions as required; §        §• have proven leadership skills and supervisory experience as you will be working with a sizeable team of part-timers and full-timers; §        §• ability to oversee the rosters for a large number of team members to ensure 100% coverage at the check-out area and service desk; §        §• experience working with a POS system (specific training given); §        §• a can do attitude; §        §• & be computer savvy. §        §Experience in a similar role, and/or retail environment will be beneficial. Reporting to the Customer Service & Checkouts Coordinator, you will be expected to work on a roster basis, with at least one day per weekend work included. If you believe you are the person we are looking for, please forward a CV and cover letter via this website.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Are you keen to put your leadership skills to work and join a strong Kiwi business in growth mode? Not only are we growing as a business, we are proud to be voted New Zealand’s most trusted home improvement brand. §Mitre 10 Mega Nelson, is a dynamic and growing business with a vision to provide great quality products and the best value and expertise to enable our customers to have an affordable and easy DIY experience. §This is a key role within our store, requiring a quick thinking and capable person to join our busy Customer Services front desk and Checkouts team. This position requires the successful applicant to deal with customer and team enquiries, telephone calls, finance applications, product location, checkout sales and all the other ‘one off’ situations that arise on a day to day basis. The customer service desk is the face of our business, so we are looking for that special someone. §The Check-Out team often deliver the first and last impression of our business and the person we seek to supervise this area must have the ability to remain cool under pressure and be able to think on their feet. §To be successful you must have: §• a passion for providing excellent customer service each and every time; §• be a detail minded self-starter; §• Strong mathematical skills; §• be able to multi-task, and have the ability to follow through and follow up situations in a timely manner; §• experience in conflict resolution and confidence to make decisions as required; §• have proven leadership skills and supervisory experience as you will be working with a sizeable team of part-timers and full-timers; §• ability to oversee the rosters for a large number of team members to ensure 100% coverage at the check-out area and service desk; §• experience working with a POS system (specific training given); §• a can do attitude; §• & be computer savvy. §Experience in a similar role, and/or retail environment will be beneficial. Reporting to the Customer Service & Checkouts Coordinator, you will be expected to work on a roster basis, with at least one day per weekend work included. If you believe you are the person we are looking for, please forward a CV and cover letter via this website.§ §§§§

With multiple stations throughout New Zealand, our growth and success is driven by outstanding people who are motivated to do their best and have a passion for putting the customer at the heart of everything they do.  We thrive on a culture which is underpinned by our core values of Open Communication, Working Together, Feeling Valued and Customer Centric. We are always looking for talented people who are excited to join our team and help contribute to the continuing growth and success of Europcar. §        §We are currently seeking a dedicated and proactive part-time team member for our Nelson location. §        §Reporting to the Field Manager this role plays a critical part in ensuring excellent sales and customer service for our clients whilst being dedicated to the growing success of the Station.§        §Some of the key responsibilities include:§        §          §Opening and closing car rental contracts§          §Making reservations and checking vehicles in and out as based on customer needs§          §Processing of Rental Agreements, accident and damage reports§          §Providing outstanding customer service to our valued customers§          §Cleaning / ferrying vehicles§          §Checking vehicles for damage and roadworthiness, using hand held device§          §Achieving targets in sales and Net Promoter Score§        §        §You will need to be flexible and available to work on a rotating shift roster. §        §To be considered, you should posses:§        §          §Full New Zealand work rights§          §Ability to work around a 7 day rotating shift roster§          §Open, manual licence§          §Experience working in a customer service/ Sales/ Retail environment§        §        §In return, the successful candidate will receive:§        §          §Multiple staff discounts (including Accor hotel staff discounts after 12+ months)§          §Employment with a company who invests in training their employees§          §Supportive team environment§        §        §Please note, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.§        §§      §      §      §    §  §§§About Us§  §Europcar is a world leader in vehicle rental and part of the global Europcar Mobility Group. With multiple stations throughout New Zealand, our growth and success is driven by outstanding people who are motivated to do their best and have a passion for putting the customer at the heart of everything they do.  We thrive on a culture which is underpinned by our core values of Open Communication, Working Together, Feeling Valued and Customer Centric. We are always looking for talented people who are excited to join our team and help contribute to the continuing growth and success of Europcar. §  §We are currently seeking a dedicated and proactive part-time team member for our Nelson location. §  §Reporting to the Field Manager this role plays a critical part in ensuring excellent sales and customer service for our clients whilst being dedicated to the growing success of the Station.§  §Some of the key responsibilities include:§ § §Opening and closing car rental contracts§ §Making reservations and checking vehicles in and out as based on customer needs§ §Processing of Rental Agreements, accident and damage reports§ §Providing outstanding customer service to our valued customers§ §Cleaning / ferrying vehicles§ §Checking vehicles for damage and roadworthiness, using hand held device§ §Achieving targets in sales and Net Promoter Score§ §You will need to be flexible and available to work on a rotating shift roster. §  §To be considered, you should posses:§ § §Full New Zealand work rights§ §Ability to work around a 7 day rotating shift roster§ §Open, manual licence§ §Experience working in a customer service/ Sales/ Retail environment§ §In return, the successful candidate will receive:§ § §Multiple staff discounts (including Accor hotel staff discounts after 12+ months)§ §Employment with a company who invests in training their employees§ §Supportive team environment§ §Please note, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Are you available to work on a rotating roster?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§Are you licenced to drive a manual vehicle?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50666510.txt	§CUSTOMER SERVICE MANAGER§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§CUSTOMER SERVICE MANAGER§§Advertiser: §SIFA NEW ZEALAND§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Management & Support§§§§§§ABOUT SIFA§  §With 30 offices, worldwide in 16 different countries, SIFA is a well-known French freight forwarder and a leading consolidator to the French overseas territories. The company has over 600 employees worldwide in its own network and a total turnover of AUD 100M (for more information visit our web site www.sifalogistics.com).§  §Our New Zealand branch ensures direct consolidation services to the Pacific Islands, Import and Export Air/Sea operations globally.§ §ABOUT THE ROLE §  §Currently, we are looking to add a stellar Customer Service Manager. Ideally the successful candidate will have a minimum of 3-5 years experiences within the freight forwarding industry.§ §DUTIES §  §Integral part of a small team, we are looking for someone flexible, hard worker and willing to evolve in the position and the company. The role is ensuring the customer service side and the operations of our “French Pacific” trade. You will be doing sea freight (LCL & FCL) and air freight, as well as dealing directly with customer and SIFA offices in New Caledonia and Tahiti.  The main tasks and duties are:§ § §Following up orders§ §Liaising with both NZ suppliers and our customers in New Caledonia and French Polynesia§ §Collection and dispatch of cargo§ §Quoting existing customers§ §Ensuring all documentation processing from A to Z§ §Travels to the French Territories§ §To success, you will need to be able to understand the client’s needs and requirements and the technical side of the freight chain.§  § §SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE§  §Air/Sea Import/Export knowledge§ § §Excellent customer service skills, both verbal and written§ §Excellent time management skills & a 'can do' attitude§ §French speaker is required§ §GOOD REASON TO JOIN? §  §Hard working but friendly work environment in a multicultural team. You will be given the opportunity to learn and evolve in the company. §  §Strong training policy§  §Package depending on profile.§  §****§  §To apply send your resume and cover letter to  atornel@sifalogistics.com  or on Seek.§  §****§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have freight forwarding experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50638791.txt	§Christmas Customer Service Ambassadors – Westfield St Lukes§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Christmas Customer Service Ambassadors – Westfield St Lukes§§Advertiser: §Scentre Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Every day, our people play a vital role in our purpose to ‘create extraordinary places, connecting and enriching communities.’§At Christmas, our customers look forward to experiencing the Christmas festivities at their local Westfield living centres that simply isn’t experienced anywhere else; which is why we are currently seeking Ambassadors to join our Westfield Customer Experience team to make this Christmas§ extraordinary! §Our Ambassadors play an important role in elevating the Christmas shopping experience by making it easy, festive, and fun for our customers across all service areas including Concierge, Valet, and Hands-Free Shopping. These roles will focus on delivering the highest quality customer experience every day to over 27,000 customers across Australia and New Zealand.§What sets you apart as a Westfield Christmas Customer Services Ambassador?§§You are customer-obsessed and ooze enthusiasm and positivity§Always willing to go above and beyond for our customers and retailers; making a difference to their day§Embody patience, empathy and know how to operate in the moment and remain present within a fast-paced retail environment§You are personable and genuinely love interacting with customers§You are curious; think on your feet and like to think ‘outside the box’§Empowered to rectify and resolve customer questions§You feel confident in providing assistance, directions, and information to customers in a busy retail environment.§§Your checklist:§§These positions will commence in §November 2020 §until §January/February 2021 §so regular availability is essential for these roles§Adequate flexibility to work across a 7-day week (Monday-Sunday) including Public Holidays.§§All successful candidates will be required to complete an automated video interview as part of our screening process, a medical assessment, and need to be comfortable to walk up to 10,000 steps per shift and feel at ease on their feet for up to 8 hours. We will be using email as the primary method of communication, so please ensure you keep an eye on your emails to monitor your application status.§What sets us apart?§Our diverse and inclusive workforce is not only something we’re proud of, but something we’re committed to. We encourage and support our people to bring their ‘whole selves’ to work every day. This is because we believe all our differences contribute to our success and ensures a workforce that reflects the customers we serve. Our commitment is backed by executive and employee-led working groups including All Abilities, LGBTI, Mental Health & Wellness, and Gender Equity alongside other initiatives such as our Reconciliation Action Plan to grow our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander workforce.§This is a §seasonal casual position§ and is the perfect chance to shine, gain valuable experience to get your foot in the door for a career at Scentre Group.§If this sounds like you, please click ‘apply’ today to start an application to become a Westfield Christmas Ambassador and make someone’s Christmas Extraordinary! Should you have any questions regarding these positions, please don’t hesitate to email our dedicated Christmas Talent Acquisition team, via §scentregroupcareers@scentregroup.com§.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50688779.txt	§Technical Service Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Service Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Electra Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§ §Newly created customer services / technical role§ §Utilise your administration, coordination, and technical nous§ §Tauranga based, work close to home!§ §Join a local, growing business in the exciting technology sector!§ §SECURELY® is a Levin-based company that provides medical alarms, house alarms and business alarms. We offer a 24/7 alarm monitoring service for our wide range of customers throughout New Zealand with offices in Levin, Tauranga, and Lower Hutt.  SECURELY® embraces cutting-edge international technology to deliver alarm solutions over and above what is expected and with an enviable product range, we’re experiencing fantastic growth.  The future looks bright.§ §This is a unique role which requires someone who loves all things technical and technology, has an inquisitive mind, loves variety and is exceptionally passionate about providing great outcomes to our customers.§ §The role has a mixed and varied list of responsibilities, that includes:§ § § Providing up to date and timely support to any customer enquiry§ §Supporting our Technical Specialist with coordinating medical cases (triaging of the diagnosis of issues, leading to repair or replacement of medical alarms) and when required providing support for our security-based customers§ §Refurbishing, reprogramming, and coordinating the servicing of medical alarms§ §Managing incoming stock, ensuring it is entered into the CRM for accurate inventory control§ §Recording the movement of stock§ §Dispatching and couriering of new alarms and equipment to customers, 3rd party suppliers and partners§ §About you:§ §You have a lovely, approachable personality where customers feel listened to, and looked after.  You are timely with your communication and keeping people updated whenever required. As this is a varied role, your attention to detail must be task focused, to ensure each task is always carried out with 100% accuracy.§ §You are supportive, focused on the minor details to ensure jobs are managed in a timely manner and meet service level agreements, and enjoy working in a busy and fast-paced role.  Your passion for technology will show through your inquisitive mind on the job, learning about and refurbishing and repairing our alarms, under the guidance of our Technical Specialist. § §You are computer savvy, love working with systems and seeing the outcome of the work you perform.  You do not mind working under pressure, and are deadline driven and able to multi-task.§ §You will have 2+ years of experience in a customer service role, perhaps from a telecommunication, POS refurbishment or similar technology-based product where repairs and service are part of the business’s operation!§ §On offer:§ §Is a competitive market salary, an enviable company benefits and wellbeing program, and the chance to learn and develop a unique set of skills, stamping your mark on this role and our business.§ §If this sounds like you, and our values resonate with you as a person, please, do not delay, apply today!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50607934.txt	§Customer Service Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representative§§Advertiser: §Toyota§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Customer Service Representative §    §    §      §        §Toyota New Zealand is a wholly owned subsidiary of Toyota Motor Corporation, Japan and in 2020 celebrated 33 years of vehicle market leadership in New Zealand. We constantly strive to deliver customer satisfaction and continually transform ourselves to meet our customer's needs and styles, passion’s and dreams.  From the moment you enter Toyota - you will notice a difference!  We back our people to do extraordinary things and believe that if you can dream it, you can do it!§        §Based at our National Headquarters in Palmerston North, we currently have a full-time position within our award-winning Customer Care Centre to work as a Customer Service Representative (Monday - Friday).  The CSR position is an empowered one that represents the voice of Toyota New Zealand and our customers, and the role offers the opportunity to deliver exceptional service to our customers every day.  In a supportive team environment, you are working directly with our customers, dealers and internal departments via phone, email, chat and social media. You will offer personalised customer support and be a team player. Alongside that you will be organised, willing to take ownership of cases, proactive in sourcing information and able to investigate and find solutions that benefit both Toyota and our customers. §        §We pride ourselves on our people so to be successful in the role you will need:§        §          §The ability to speak Mandarin is advantageous§          §To be a Self-Starter – you will be motivated, energetic, have great pride in yourself and your work and open to change§          §An EXCELLENT attitude – you are optimistic, positive and always look for the ‘yes’§          §EXCEPTIONAL customer service skills, you naturally go the extra mile for both the customer and your colleagues §          §A case management approach - you proactively ‘own’ and manage your cases, look for solutions and build “customers for life” along the way§          §Excellent time management skills and the ability to handle multiple cases with ease§          §The ability to relate to, understand and communicate with a wide variety of people§          §The ability to actively listen, use initiative and consider multiple points of view without judgement§          §To be emotionally resilient, able to work under pressure and be able to handle difficult situations with confidence§          §Strong attention to detail and ability to notice and act on opportunities for improvement §          §Intermediate computer skills (Word, Excel)§          §Previous automotive industry experience advantageous but not essential§          §Strong written and verbal English§        §        §Are you confident that you meet the above?  Then please apply with your cover letter and CV online today telling us why you think you have what it takes to excel in this role! §        §For a confidential discussion please do not hesitate to contact Annette Weatherall on §0800758673§.§        §Screening for this role will begin immediately.  Only applicants with New Zealand Citizenship or New Zealand Permanent Residency should apply.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Toyota New Zealand is a wholly owned subsidiary of Toyota Motor Corporation, Japan and in 2020 celebrated 33 years of vehicle market leadership in New Zealand.
