jobText: TXT/50670302.txt	§Tip Shop Staff Members§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Tip Shop Staff Members§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Is being physically active up on your radar?§Do have exceptional customer service skills?§Keen to be part of the Tip Shop Crew?§If you have ticked all the boxes, we would love you to apply for this role based at the Southern Landfill in Happy Valley.§Our Tip Shop is looking for 2 x permanent full-time staff members to work 5 days a week (1 role is Thursday to Monday and the other one is Tuesday to Saturday, §please specify in your cover letter if you have a preference§).§As a member of the team, you will help ensure our busy Tip Shop and Recycle Centre are resourced and up to the customer demand. You will be someone who can instantly engage with people and deliver an excellent customer experience as you will be dealing with the public receiving, sorting and diverting goods that would otherwise go to Landfill.§Rain, hail or shine you will be comfortable working at our operational site, on your feet with your high energy and positive attitude. You will be responsible for§Guiding customers with their goods§pricing and displaying goods in the Tip Shop§sales and cash handling§processing e-waste§performing daily cleaning tasks§providing informative and friendly advice to customers about correct use of our recycling facilities§Everyone loves knowing that they are contributing to something positive and we promise that is exactly how you will feel in this job. In short, our customers love us (they tell us every day), and we are a team of dedicated professionals who are working hard to make a great place that does good things, even better.§You will bring to this role;§a good level of physical fitness§excellent communication skills§competency using computers (i.e. ability to learn the touchscreen till operating system)§and most importantly heaps of enthusiasm and a can-do attitude§We offer the WCC living wage ($22.10/hr) and provide training to ensure you are able to perform all required tasks.§In return we offer a lot of benefits along with 5 weeks annual leave after 2 years of continuous service for permanent staff and a great culture to make your time with us meaningful and enjoyable§If this opportunity sounds exciting, then we welcome your application. Hit the apply button and/or to view the position description. Applications for this role close §12 October 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50588330.txt	§Scheduling and Dispatch Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Scheduling and Dispatch Representative§§Advertiser: §Vector§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Scheduling and Dispatch Representative §      §        §Who we are§        §We're on a mission. We're changing the way we engage and use power through our innovation, and our customers throughout New Zealand and Australia are seeing the benefits of Advanced Smart Metering Services (AMS), and how it's helping them to manage their gas and electricity. Vector's vision is to 'Create a new energy future' and the rollout of smart meters and smart metering services is a key part of this. Smart meters underpin the new energy future, by providing granular and real-time information about customer behaviour and energy usage, empowering new and innovative retail products, and enabling consumer participation in energy markets.§        §AMS combines large-scale field deployment and operations, with a cutting-edge data business focused on 'near real-time' delivery of big data and analytics to support the efficient functioning of the overall electricity markets in New Zealand and Australia.§        §About the role§        §Our Scheduling and Dispatch is newly created team to help our 4G deployment programme. As a part of this team and programme, our representatives will be the main contact point with our customer and Field Technicians, taking ownership of all work orders and queries.§        §Other key areas of responsibilities include:§        §          §Responding to general enquires received via phone or email promptly and efficiently with excellent customer service with a focus on first call resolution§          §Managing service requests end to end§          §Identify areas for continuous improvement§          §Work within set standards and processes to ensure Vector meets its compliance requirements§          §Liaise with the relevant parts of the business and service providers to investigate and resolve complaints promptly§        §        §Who are we looking for§        §We are looking for a great team player who thrives in a busy and collaborative environment. You will be flexible to support the workflow of your peers and be comfortable to participate in a shift-roster and on-call rosters, covering Monday to Saturday 7am to 8pm, along with:§        §          §Previous customer service or call centre experience and a strong commitment to a quality and courteous customer service§          §Great communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with both internal and external customers§          §Customer issue management and resolution experience§          §Computer literacy - Word and Excel§          §Attention to detail and accuracy in processing documentation Personal resilience, positivity, and enthusiasm§          §Ability to work from home when required§        §        §What's on offer?§        §It's an opportunity not to be missed due to the transformation in our industry and our hunger to embrace new technology. You see, at Vector we make it happen and we make it happen quick. Along with that we're committed to our team of over 800 staff, which means we're here to develop your skills, create a diverse and respectful workplace, and ensure that you succeed with us.§        §If this is the opportunity you've been looking for and have the background and experience required, show us your initiative and apply now!§        §Vector engages a workforce made up of individuals with diverse skills, values, backgrounds and experiences. Vector respects and values people who are different from each other, including gender, ethnicity, disability, age, sexual orientation, race and religion.§        §We welcome applications from all individuals. If you require assistance or accessibility support from us during the application and selection process, please do not hesitate to call us on §06 272 7950§ or email §recruitment@vector.co.nz§      §      §      §      §www.vector.co.nz§    §  §§§Who we are§ §We're on a mission. We're changing the way we engage and use power through our innovation, and our customers throughout New Zealand and Australia are seeing the benefits of Advanced Smart Metering Services (AMS), and how it's helping them to manage their gas and electricity. Vector's vision is to 'Create a new energy future' and the rollout of smart meters and smart metering services is a key part of this. Smart meters underpin the new energy future, by providing granular and real-time information about customer behaviour and energy usage, empowering new and innovative retail products, and enabling consumer participation in energy markets.§ §AMS combines large-scale field deployment and operations, with a cutting-edge data business focused on 'near real-time' delivery of big data and analytics to support the efficient functioning of the overall electricity markets in New Zealand and Australia.§ §About the role§ §Our Scheduling and Dispatch is newly created team to help our 4G deployment programme. As a part of this team and programme, our representatives will be the main contact point with our customer and Field Technicians, taking ownership of all work orders and queries.§ §Other key areas of responsibilities include:§ § §Responding to general enquires received via phone or email promptly and efficiently with excellent customer service with a focus on first call resolution§ §Managing service requests end to end§ §Identify areas for continuous improvement§ §Work within set standards and processes to ensure Vector meets its compliance requirements§ §Liaise with the relevant parts of the business and service providers to investigate and resolve complaints promptly§ §Who are we looking for§ §We are looking for a great team player who thrives in a busy and collaborative environment. You will be flexible to support the workflow of your peers and be comfortable to participate in a shift-roster and on-call rosters, covering Monday to Saturday 7am to 8pm, along with:§ § §Previous customer service or call centre experience and a strong commitment to a quality and courteous customer service§ §Great communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with both internal and external customers§ §Customer issue management and resolution experience§ §Computer literacy - Word and Excel§ §Attention to detail and accuracy in processing documentation Personal resilience, positivity, and enthusiasm§ §Ability to work from home when required§ §What's on offer?§ §It's an opportunity not to be missed due to the transformation in our industry and our hunger to embrace new technology. You see, at Vector we make it happen and we make it happen quick. Along with that we're committed to our team of over 800 staff, which means we're here to develop your skills, create a diverse and respectful workplace, and ensure that you succeed with us.§ §If this is the opportunity you've been looking for and have the background and experience required, show us your initiative and apply now!§ §Vector engages a workforce made up of individuals with diverse skills, values, backgrounds and experiences. jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§CLM are seeking applications from individuals keen to join a team that will make up the summer season team at Nayland Park Pool & Riverside Pool.  We are seeking Customer Service Representatives, Lifeguard Supervisors and Lifeguards. §  §Customer Service Representatives§  §The ideal candidate will have an exceptional interpersonal skills and telephone manner, be polite, have a bubbly personality and love working with people.  This role includes working on our front desk dealing with customers / members, and cash handling and coordinating the bookings, invoices and other administration tasks for the facility.  Previous customer service/administration experience is essential.§  §Lifeguards §  §Previous experience and qualifications would be advantageous, however on-site training will be provided for the right applicants who might be new to the industry.  The roles involve the supervision of the pool, its surrounds and patrons to ensure safety and a pleasant enjoyable experience for all.  You will be required to pass a swim test and demonstrate other aquatic skills to be capable of conducting the role. §  §Lifeguard Supervisors §  §Customer service skills and communication need to be an area of strength along with the ability to lead a team and ensure all staff are engaged and motivated.  The ideal candidates will already have qualifications, experience and knowledge within the industry, however training can be provided for the suitable applicants if required.  §  §Water treatment qualifications would be advantageous.§ You will at all times be supervising the staff working with you, as well as the safety of those staff, customers, and contractors.  You will be required to pass a swim test and demonstrate other aquatic skills to be capable of conducting the role.  §  §For all roles our ideal candidates are individuals who have a high degree of responsibility, and experience in communicating with staff and customers effectively.  The roles need motivated individuals who can follow systems and procedures correctly. §  §The ideal candidates should have the following attributes:§ § §Follow systems and procedures correctly all the time§ §Ability to lead and motivate a team§ §Focus on health & safety for the facility and experience in this area§ §Confident and experienced in the aquatic environment§ §Experience dealing with conflicts or problem resolution§ §High degree of responsibility§ §You need to be:§ § §Motivated, enthusiastic, and honest;§ §reliable;§ §Effective with communication;§ §Be well organised;§ §Strong with time management§ §Confident swimmer – for the lifeguard roles§ §The positions are fixed term for the summer season, and we open the pools from 7th November 2020 to 26th March 2021.  Training will be completed to opening during October and some roles may commence before the season opening to assist with the preparation.  The roles are structured around the opening hours of the facility and therefore may include early and late shifts, and weekend work.  You need to enjoy working with a team, be friendly, enthusiastic, honest and enjoy a bit of fun.  Fantastic customer service skills are a must!§  §If you are a team player and enjoy an exciting work environment please apply in writing with a current CV and a covering letter §stating which role you are applying for.§  §Applications close on Sunday 18th October 2020.   §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

A full and clean drivers' licence is required, as will your ability to drive a manual vehicle. §Our days revolves around our ships sailing times, therefore, you may be required to work nights, weekends and public holidays. §This is a varied role where no two days are the same and you'll be guaranteed to have fun while striving to deliver a memorable service for our travellers. You'll be part of an awesome team based at the Picton Ferry Terminal, we're a tight knit bunch, supportive and passionate about exceeding our customers' expectations.§What are we looking for?§You must love working with people and have a passion for delivering excellent customer service! You will get to meet and interact with a diverse group of travellers from all over the world and different walks of life, and you will get the opportunity to make their experience on the Bluebridge Cook Strait Ferries just a little bit more special. §We are looking for enthusiastic team players with a positive can-do attitude, fantastic communication skills and ability to remain calm under pressure. You'll be tech savvy and can pick up new systems quickly and have high attention to detail.§If you're looking for a fantastic career in tourism or customer service, then this could be the perfect role or you. We would love to hear from you, please apply online now!§§§§

jobTitle: Customer Service Superstar - Holiday Homes! Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50605742.txt	§Customer Service Superstar - Holiday Homes!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Superstar - Holiday Homes!§§Advertiser: §Bachcare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Guest Sales and Services - Bachcare Holiday Homes§ §We're on the lookout for a passionate Customer Service Superstar who loves everything about travel, tourism, and property!  Does this sound like you?  Here is your chance to join a fast-paced team who dedicate their days to ensuring that our guests find their happy place in one of our awesome holiday homes!  Right now, you'll be joining at an extraordinary time where staying at home and exploring the unique and stunning parts of Aotearoa, is keeping our whānau safe.§ §The Role:§ §You’ll be based in our Auckland office with a wonderfully supportive team around you. As a Guest Sales and Services Representative, you are pivotal to the success of our business as you are the first point of contact for our holiday guests.  You will be responsible for answering all inbound and email enquiries with the focus on converting them to holiday home bookings.  In addition, you will actively promote some of New Zealand's best holiday homes.  There will also be the requirement to support our holiday home owners too.§ §We are looking for:§ §Someone that is passionate about delivering an exceptional customer experience throughout our entire customer journey.  You must be fanatical about helping people find their happy place for their next holiday. Being a team player is really important too! You must have a can do attitude and are happy to roll up your sleeves and get stuck in.  Exceptional customer service is your forte and is something that you will not sacrifice.  You are a natural problem solver, but are confident and happy to ask when you need to.  You go above and beyond for your customers and colleagues.§ § § §Important Skills to Have:§ § §Meticulous eye for detail§ §12+ months call centre experience§ §Exceptional work ethic§ §Exceptional verbal and written communication§ §Results driven§ §Highly motivated§ §Great problem solver and lateral, innovative thinker§ § § §Our Culture:§ §We are a team that is happy to roll up our sleeves to get the job done!  We're honest and humble, curious and innovative, and most importantly we deliver amazingness in everything that we do.  We are fully supportive of a flexible working environment too, so we are happy for your time to be spread between our Support Office in Parnell and your home office, if remote working is your jam. We've proudly been selected as finalists for The Westpac Business Awards' Employer of the Year, 2020.§ § § §About Bachcare Holiday Homes:§ §Since 2003, Bachcare has been helping holiday home owners and holidaymakers find their happy place. We fully manage the holiday home on behalf of the owner - they simply give us the keys and we will deliver them a return and take care of everything else, including listing on multiple booking sites. Not only are we now managing over 2000 holiday homes nationwide (the largest in New Zealand), but we also have a high performing guest site where over 2 million holidaymakers visit every year and can directly book a Bachcare Holiday Home.§ § § §Ready To Apply? Send your CV and cover letter through via Seek.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§If you could only choose one NZ holiday destination to visit for the rest of your life, where would it be and why?§Can you give a specific example of a time that you have gone above and beyond? Describe why you took this approach?§This role is made up of a variety of day, evening and weekend shifts which will run across 5 days out of 7, any time Monday-Sunday, between 7am and 12am.  Are you able to commit to these type of shifts?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50605298.txt	§Customer Service and Works Programmer - Rongotai§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service and Works Programmer - Rongotai§§Advertiser: §Fulton Hogan§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Supervisors/Team Leaders§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Customer Service and Works Programmer - Rongotai §      §        §Who are we looking for?§        §Due to Fulton Hogan’s ongoing growth within the Region, we are looking for a Customer Service and Works Programmer to join our team and deliver the good work Fulton Hogan is known for.§        §The job§We are looking for someone with customer service and work planning experience to be part of our operational maintenance team. You will be responsible for developing and overseeing  the delivery of the planned work program. You will also arrange relevant communication to the stake holders affected by the works. The role will involve planning crews and works, using your technical knowledge of the industry with a focus on customers and stakeholder management.§        §Experience and attributes;§        §          §Experience within a civil construction/road maintenance environment preferred.§          §Planning & programming experience.§          §Full class 1 drivers’ license.§          §Ability to problem solve & think on your feet.§          §An unwavering commitment towards living safely with a safety record to match.§          §Possess a positive, can-do attitude.§          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to relate to people of all levels.§          §Ability to understand complex information and retain it.§        §        §We’re Fulton Hogan§You’ve probably seen us around. On the roads, building sites, and in cities, towns and locations all over New Zealand, Australia and the South Pacific. We build and maintain infrastructure that improves the quality of life for those living in our communities. Everything from roads and bridges to energy, water and communication. jobText: TXT/50709528.txt	§Spark Representative - Hastings§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Spark Representative - Hastings§§Advertiser: §Spark New Zealand Trading Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§At Spark we're proud of helping of all New Zealand win big in a digital world. As part of fulfilling our purpose, we are embarking on a journey and a new way of working called Unified Frontline, with the overarching ambition that our people are unified in their customer obsession and can provide a consistent customer experience across all ways that we interact with our customers.§This is where you come in! We are on the lookout for amazing individuals to join us on this journey.§As a Spark Representative, I am someone who:§Is truly customer obsessed by putting them at the centre of everything we do.§Loves a variety of work and strives for continuous development.§Has a passion for working day-to-day within a team that thrives off sharing knowledge and expertise (to support a culture of continuous learning, where you learn from others and they learn from you).§Exuding passion and energy to foster enthusiasm among the team in bringing Unified Frontline's vision to life.§Is adaptable and flexible to changes as we evolve through Unified Frontline, as a team and as a business.§What will this look§ §like§ §for you?§-When you join Spark, we will kickstart your career with us by upskilling you in what we call the 'universal skillset' which is will provide you with the foundation of knowledge and skills to interact with a customer regardless of how they choose to get in touch with us. From there, you will be able to learn on the job, and apply your learnings to what we refer to as a 'touchpoint' (the way we interact with our customers) such as retail or contact centre.§-You will start with one form of interacting with a customer. However, the amazing thing is, once you build your confidence and hunger for development, you will be able to move onto another touchpoint.§-The team you will work with is made up of customer obsessed people who are also self-driving their own learning. This means that while showing up for our customers consistently, and you can lean on your team members to support you to ensure you can provide that end to end customer service.§This will mean that we can provide our customers with world class service by flowing to where the customer needs us, through the channel of their choice. This will further your sales career giving you incredible opportunities to grow and develop your career and skillset with us.§At Spark,§ we are a 7 day a week business with a very diverse customer base so there is a need for flexibility and embracing what it takes to support our people and customers. With that, there will be a need at times to be adaptable in terms of working across different Spark locations and different rosters/schedules.§If you have previous customer service or sales experience, love technology, thrive in a fast pace environment, and can connect with a diverse range of people, you could be just the person we are looking for.§Not only are we customer inspired but we're also about making you feel at valued and appreciated. That is why we have put in place a competitive salary and commission, and generous staff benefits.§Feel like being world class?§ §We need people like you to make it happen,§*§a§*pply today.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50709453.txt	§Insurance Claims Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insurance Claims Representative§§Advertiser: §AA Insurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$50,000+ depending on experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Here at AA Insurance we are humbled and grateful to say our business is valued more than ever and we are growing our teams to reflect our customer's needs.§You need no Insurance experience just proven experience in excelling at offering solutions to customers. You could be from the travel industry, emergency services, banking, store cards, telecommunications etc. You will be someone that genuinely wants the best for people and loves going the extra mile and really helping and solving your customer's needs, especially in times of real need. That's what it takes to be an Insurance Claims Representative, someone who is there for our customers often in times of crisis.§Using your highly effective listening, communication and interpersonal skills you will take ownership of getting customers sorted when they need it the most …. at claim time. With your exceptional customer service skills and your ability to effectively assess the needs of our customers, they will instantly feel at ease talking to you and know they are in safe hands. This role will see you as the first contact our customers have when they want to make an insurance claim. Often calling you in times of emergency, for example a car accident, house fire, flood etc. You will be the calming voice on the end of the phone, ready to help and reassure them.§You will be supported through our comprehensive training and coaching programmes to become empowered decision makers, to find the best solutions for our customers. With your proven customer service experience, you will use common sense and judgement in your decision making and have a strong sense of urgency with your work. You will enjoy thinking outside the box to identify opportunities to drive customers to our preferred suppliers, whilst also seeking out ways to consistently provide exceptional customer service.§To shine in the role:§Proven experience in a customer service role ideally in a similar role where you assess customer needs and offer solutions. A call-based environment is preferred but not essential.§You are passionate about helping people and providing solutions§You will have a strong sense of urgency§You are compassionate and reassuring in a crisis§You will use your initiative and common sense in decision-making§You will start with 3 ½ weeks of full-time paid training. You will then move onto a rotating roster, working 7.5 hour shifts totalling 37.5 hours a week between 8am - 8pm on weekdays and 8am - 6pm on weekends. Weekend work is generally 1-2 weekend days per month.§The Perks!§A generous starting salary of $50k+ depending on experience§Annual salary reviews and an achievable and generous annual bonus§A strong focus on training, staff developments and internal promotions§An award winning wellbeing programme§Fantastic discounts on our insurance products (including up to 50% off car insurance) as well as at a number of retail outlet§If you are ready to take on a new career and willing to learn then please send through your CV and cover letter by Monday 19th October. This role starts on Monday 23rd November.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
